Tiene la cantidad de tres  hijos dos mujeres y varón quienes le ayudan a envolver regalos y en forrar cuádrenos ya que  sus hijos están orgullosos de ella por el esfuerzo que hace día con día para darles un mejor futuro.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía para papelería como son: cuadernos, librestas, diccionario.corector papel  china, papel bom, papel lustres, papel  fantasía, lápices, colores  etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Rufina- quien se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes.
Catalina  Alejandrina  -quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudar a las  mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Banda."  It is made up of three hard-working, humble women who hope to increase their incomes, to be able to grow their businesses and to improve their neighborhood by offering more merchandise.  That way the people won't have to go to neighboring areas to purchase things they can't find in their town.
One of the members of this group is Elida, a teacher.  She teaches in a kindergarten and has also made a living for the last three years selling stationary items and traditional clothing.  
She is happily married to another teacher, Yoryino.  He is a friendly and hard-working man who helps her attend to the customers so they can leave pleased with their purchases.
Elida has three children, two girls and a boy, who help to wrap gifts and cover notebooks.  Her children are proud of her for the effort she puts forth each day to give them a better future.
Elida requested the loan to purchase more stationary items like: notebooks, log books, dictionaries, white-out, tissue paper, paper napkins, construction paper, wrapping paper, pencils, crayons etc.
The other members of the communal bank are:
Rufina- who makes her living selling groceries.
Catalina  Alejandrina- who makes her living selling shoes.

They are grateful to the Foundation for helping hard-working women.

loans.use: to purchase stationary merchandise for re-salel.

loans.name: San Luis Sito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre San Luis sito, esta historia es acerca de la señora aleida ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo  cuenta con 27 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene 2  hijos Gabriel y José Manuel de los cuales solo el mayor estudia, cursa segundo año de primaria, ya que el menor apenas tiene 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos hace apenas 1 año.

Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio porque quería buscar la forma de apoyar a sus pequeños hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida, aparte de que esta actividad le permite estar al pendiente de ellos y no descuidarlos, también para contar con una solvencia económica más estable, el crédito que pidió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de más pollos, para continuar con sus ventas.

La meta que tiene doña aleida es darles una excelente calidad de vida a sus hijos, ya que también quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio tanto que está pensando en ahorrar para construir un local y poner su pollería en un lugar estable, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Ella dice que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones y les gusta mucho trabajar, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad.

Doña aleida da las gracias a nombre de ella y de su familia a Fundación realidad y kiva  por que gracias a ellos podrá mejorar su vida y la de su familia, puesto que ahora tendrán una excelente calidad de vida y solvencia económica.

Las integrantes del grupo san Luis sito y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: clemente-tiene un sonido, José-albañil, aleida-venta de pollos, agustin-pescaderia y Jacob-venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group has the name San Luis Sito. The people who formed it decided to give it this name because this is the name of the community where they live. This story is about Señora Aleida, since she is one of the members of the group. She is 27 years old and is a single mother. She has two children, Gabriel and José Manuel, of whom only the older is in school, in the second year of primary school, since the younger is barely 3 years old. She has been selling chickens almost one year.

She says that she decided to begin this business because she wanted to look for a way to support her little sons and offer them a better quality of life. In addition to this, this business allows her to take care of her children and not neglect them and also to have a more stable financial solvency. She is going to use the loan that she has requested to invest in the purchase of more chickens, to continue with her sales.

Doña Aleida's goal is to give an excellent quality of life to her sons, since she also wants to make her business grow a lot more, to the extent that she is thinking about saving to construct a shop and set up her chicken business in a stable place to improve and increase her earnings.

She says that all her fellow group members are responsible people who fulfill their obligations and very much like to work, to aim ever higher and excel in the face of any difficulty.

Doña Aleida gives thanks in her name and that of her family to Fundación Realidad and Kiva, because thanks to them she will be able to improve her life and that of her family, since now she will have an excellent quality of life and economic solvency.

The members of the group San Luis Sito and their business activities are the following: Clemente, sound business; José, mason; Aleida, selling chickens; Agustin, fish market; and Jacob, selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens to continue her sales.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 1 Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras  se formó con la unión de 16 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjunto que fortalecen su compañerismo.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades.
La Señora Vicenta es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, bebidas y demás. Ella tiene 3 hijos y comenta que su marido es constructor. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con sus actividades y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo, pues le ha sido de mucha ayuda para salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, pollo, jamón, queso, y demás insumos que necesita para la elaboración de los alimentos que prepara, para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women) formed when 16 neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso got together.  All of the members of the communal bank have developed independent businesses, but they also have some joint businesses that strengthen their companionship.  The members make up a very united communal group capable of jointly carrying out their activities.
Señora Vicenta is one of the members of the communal bank.  She makes her living selling fast food, drinks and other items.  She has 3 children and says that her husband is a building contractor.  She is quite satisfied with the communal bank's activities and the trainings that they receive, which have been a great help in her business moving forward.
Señora Vicenta is requesting the loan to purchase red meat, condiments, chicken, ham, cheese and other supplies that she needs to make the foods she prepares, which will enable her to keep working.

loans.use: to purchase red meat, condiments, chicken, ham, cheese and other supplies.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad, ellos viven en un AAHH de nombre “ 9 de Febrero “ el cual pertenece al distrito de Morrope a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo aproximadamente. La zona en la que vive Hilda así como muchos de ese distrito es agrícola y ganadera específicamente.

La actividad económica que realiza Hilda es la crianza y posterior venta de animales como: ovinos, caprinos y aves de corral en gran mayoría, para lo que ha acondicionado en la parte posterior de su vivienda lugares estratégicos para la crianza, engorde y promoción de cada uno de sus animales que vende. Hilda recorre los mercados de Chiclayo para ofrecer sus animales para lo que ya tiene sus clientes fijos quienes la consideran mucho por su forma de negociar, pues refieren que es una mujer muy responsable con sus compromisos relacionados a los negocios.

Hilda ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1200 Nuevos Soles los cuales servirán para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el mejor engorde de sus animales ya a la vez la compra de Eternit (calamina) el cual servirá para los techos de sus corrales con los que los tendrá mas seguro.

En esta Institución Hilda ya es conocida por sus constantes créditos otorgados gracias a su responsabilidad y pagos oportunos al igual a éste que se compromete ella y su esposo a cumplirlos de acuerdo a cronograma.
texts.en:
Hilda is 43 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in their own house. They live in a settlement called 9 de Febrero, which is in Morrope District, approximately one hour from the city of Chiclayo. The area where Hilda lives, like many in this district, is principally devoted to agriculture and cattle raising.

Hildra raises and sells animals, principally sheep, goats and poultry. She has fixed up the rear part of her dwelling with specific places for the raising, fattening and promotion of each one of the animals that she sells. Hilda travels the markets of Chiclayo to sell her animals and has fixed customers who are drawn to her way of doing business. They note that she is a very responsible woman in terms of her business commitments.

Hilda has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative for the sum of 1200 nuevos soles which she will use to purchase feed to fatten her animals and at the same time she will buy Eternit (corrugated zinc) that she will use for the roofs of her animal corrals so they will be more secure.

Hilda is already well known by this field partner because of the steady loans provided her, thanks to her responsible behavior and prompt repayments. Similarly she and her husband promise to make payments for this new loan in a responsible and timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase feed and corrugated zinc.

loans.name: Sini Titi San Andres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Sini Titi San Andrés esta integrando por diez  personas trabajadoras comerciantes y humildes.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora  Margarita una señora trabajadora y humilde de sesenta años de edad.
Ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de  hierbas curativas y a la venta de antojitos mexicanos y tamales desde hace siete años.
Es  madre soltera   ella nos cuenta que desde que se quedo soltera siente  mejor y con mas fuerzas ya que ha podido valerse por ella misma y darse cuenta que vale mucho como mujer ya que se considera una mejor trabajadora con fuerzas para seguir creciendo con sus negocios como la venta de comida y hierbas.
Tiene  un hijo quien también se dedica a la venta de hierbas curativas , el nos cuenta que esta muy orgulloso de su mama ya que es una señora trabajadora y humilde.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas hierbas curativas y para ingredientes para la elaboración de comida como es: chile verde, chile  seco, manteca  ,jitomate ,carnes y verduras.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Alberta- quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Yesenia-quien se dedica a la venta de bisutería.
Silvia- quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Teofila-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Damian –quien se dedica a la venta de  hierbas curativas.
Vianney-quien se dedica a la venta de dulces.
María-quien se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Nélida-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Bianca-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Le dan las gracias a fundación Realidad  por el apoyo que les ha dado para   que puedan hacer que sus negocios crezcan.
texts.en:
This group is named Sini Titi San Andrés and is made up of ten hardworking and modest people, storekeepers.  One of the members of this group is Margarita, a hardworking and modest 60-year-old woman.  She tells us that for seven years she has worked selling curative herbs and Mexican snacks and tamales.

She is a single mother.  She says that since she became single she feels better and with more strength, because she has been able to manage on her own by herself and realize that she matters a lot as a woman.  She considers herself a better worker with the strength to continue growing with her businesses, such as selling food and herbs.  She has a son who also works selling curative herbs.  He tells us that he is very proud of his mother because she is a hardworking and modest woman.

She requesting the loan to buy more curative herbs and for ingredients to make food, such as green chile, dried chile, lard, tomato, meat, and vegetables.

The other members of the group are Alberta, who sells chicken; Yesenia, who sells costume jewelry; Silvia, who sells perfume; Teofila, who sells Mexican snacks; Damián, who sells curative herbs; Vianney, who sells sweets; María, who sells cheese; Nélida, who sells Mexican snacks; and Bianca, who sells clothing.

They thank Fundación Realidad for the support it has given them so they can make their businesses grow.

loans.use: to buy curative herbs.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and works hard to provide for her family.  She has had this business for 3 years, and also earns an income from fishing.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store like shampoo, snack foods, etc.

Nelita borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before applying for this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell like shampoo, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Crispina's Group

texts.en:
Crispina is 58 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children.  She has a general store where she sells groceries and other products. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of to purchase additional goods and grocery items for sale.

Crispina has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.  She is the leader of a 4 person group. Although they borrow as a group, all members of the group have their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат женщина 36 лет, замужем , имеет троих детей. Она торгует на вещевом рынке мужской одеждой. Её муж работает на стройке, особенно в летний сезон. А зимой он занимается животноводством, поэтому Каромат сама занимается бизнесом,а по завозу ей помогает её сын. Товар он привозит из Бишкека, один раз в месяц.На полученную прибыль Каромат смогла сделать косметический ремонт своего дома,причём помог ей её муж, т.к. он хороший мастер своего дела. На запрашиваемую сумму она хочет привезти весенние свитера и брюки для мужчин.
texts.en: Karomat is a 36 year old woman. She is married and has three children. She sells men's clothes on the clothing market. Her husband works in construction especially during the summer season. In the winter he does animal husbandry so this is why Karomat runs the business herself and her son helps her with bringing in the goods. The merchandise is brought in from Bishkek once a month. Karomat used the received profit to make cosmetic repairs of her home and her husband actually helped her in this because he is a professional in this field. She is asking for a loan to bring in sweaters for the spring and pants for men.

loans.use: to purchase of spring sweaters and pants for men.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Thorn, 41, is married, resides with her husband, and has six children.  She lives in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (such as the ancient temples at Angkor Wat, Bayon, and Banteay Srey). She is a homemaker, and her husband is a motor taxi driver who approximately earns USD 8 per day. Her son is also a motor taxi driver, and earns approximately USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Thorn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a Tuk Tuk trailer for her husband, who wants to run a transportation service for tourists who come to visit Siem Reap. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house and support her children in their pursuit of higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk trailer for her husband

loans.name: Las Hermanas Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Las Hermanas, es de la Ciudad de Carapeguá.  Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 10º ciclo con 15 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran por salir adelante, ya que desean darle a sus familias todas las comodidades que necesiten.
Digna es una de las miembros del grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que diariamente empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas, ya que desde esas horas  ya tiene clientes que acuden a su despensa. Tiene un negocio bien surtido, y nos cuenta que empezó con un pequeño local, pero que por medio de su esfuerzo ha podido crecer.
Ella solicita el crédito a la fundación paraguaya para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, fideos, lácteos, y demás insumos, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group called Las Hermanas (The Sisters) is from the town of Carapeguá. There are 15 in the group and they are currently on their tenth loan cycle. The women are hardworking and make a lot of effort to get on as they wish to provide their families with all that they need. 

Digna is one of the members of the group. She is a hardworking determined woman who starts work every day at an early hour, the time when her customers go to her store. She has a well-stocked store which she began in small premises but through her efforts has been able to move to a bigger location. 

Digna is seeking a loan from the Paraguaya Foundation to buy basics such as sugar, pasta, dairy products etc. She is very grateful for the opportunity that she and her friends have to receive a loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pasta, dairy products etc

loans.name: Ania Lucrecia

texts.es:
Ania mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, comerciante sus planes mejorar poco a poco su nivel de vida así como la infraestructura de su vivienda. Tiene su propio negocio desde hace un tiempo siendo su medio de trabajo. 
Con este nuevo ciclo de crédito comprara productos como: granos básicos, cigarros, abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas, lácteo, así también el ingreso de nuevos productos blusas, camisolas, camisolines, faldas, pantalones, blúmeres, mosquiteros, calcetas, toallas de manos, entre otros productos. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo continuo a cumplir sus metas, proyectos. Ya que con esta inversión obtendrá tener su pulpería mas surtida. Con mayores recurso para ofrecerle a su familia mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Ania is an enterprising, hardworking businesswoman who plans to improve her standard of living and renovate her house little by little. She has run her own business for some time now. 

With this new loan Ania plans to buy basic grains, cigarettes, groceries, drinks, candy, and milk products. In addition she wishes to introduce new items such as blouses, camisoles, undershirts, skirts, pants, underwear, mosquito nets, knitting wool, hand towels etc. She is grateful to the donors for the continuing support. With this loan she will be able to have a better-stocked store, and a greater income will mean she can provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy various products for her store

loans.name: Susana's Group

texts.en:
Susana is 66 years old and lives in Map-an. She is married with 10 children. For the past 27 years, she has had a general store. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more products for her general store.

Susana has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business. She is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, both members of the group have their own business.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is 31 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. She is a government employee and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase more equipment for her home renovation. 

Maria Luz has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to open a business.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her home renovation.

loans.name: Microempresarios Emprendedores Group

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene  42 años de edad, es casada  y tiene 2 hijos menores. Ella es la tesorera  de la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Microempresarios Emprendedores” la cual lo conforma 07 personas emprendedoras dedicadas a distintas actividades comerciales. María  se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, siendo la gran mayoría de sus clientes sus familiares y vecinos de su zona, lleva en este negocio más de 01 año. Aparte cada fines de semana brinda servicio de limpieza, de donde obtiene un ingreso extra para su hogar. Uno de sus mayores logros fue  sacar adelante a sus hijos, lo que sigue después es seguir trabajando positivamente y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El crédito recibido lo invertirá para comprar productos naturales como extractos, polen, etc.  y así tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. La Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Microempresarios Emprendedores”agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She is the treasurer of the communal bank “Microempresarios Emprendedores” which is comprised of seven enterprising people who run different businesses. 

María sells natural products. The vast majority of her customers are relatives and neighbours who live nearby. She’s had the business for more than a year. As well, she does cleaning at weekends to bring in some extra income. One of her biggest challenges is to help her children get ahead so she wants to continue working and provide her family with a better standard of living. 

She plans to buy natural products such as extracts and pollen to offer to her customers with the loan money. Her communal bank is grateful for these loans which make progress possible.

loans.use: to buy natural products

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Andresa, ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como, pero también hacen actividades juntas como grupo. El comité se Denomina Mujeres Valientes  están en el Décimo Tercer Ciclo  con 19  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables entre ellas, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor y luchador.
Una de las miembros es la señora Claudelina, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de variada clase. Dice que por medio de su negocio ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones, su meta es poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia. Es para ello que solicita el crédito, pues quiere comprar más prendas, para poder abastecerse y tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Andresa contacted her neighbors and friends in her area to form the committee, Mujeres Valientes (Brave Women).  The members have their own businesses but also do things as a group and this is their third loan cycle.  The group has 19 members and is known in the neighborhood as being very supportive, united and responsible with each other.  They also have a great entrepreneurial and determined spirit.
One of the members is Claudelina who sells all types of clothing.  She says that she has been able to help her family and give them what they need to have a life without deprivations because of her business. Her goal is to be able to continue developing as a micro entrepreneur and helping her family.  For these reasons she is requesting the loan; she wants to buy more clothing to stock her business and to have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell later

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. To earn a living, Thelma has a business selling dried fish. She earns about 1,500 PHP each month doing this type of work.

Thelma has requested a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her dried fish retail business. Thelma has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Thelma would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her dried fish retail business

loans.name: Alice Group

texts.en:
Alice is married with 3 children. Alice is 40 years old and lives in Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Alice is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing fertilizer and seedlings. Alice has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. 

In the future, Alice hopes to expand her garden. Alice is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 58 years old and lives in Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 4 children. Luz has a general store business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Luz has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Luz hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 39 years old and married with 4 children.

Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. Nida has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for 10 years and also earns an income from a hardware business.

Nida aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a single parent of 2 children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from house rental. 

Rebecca is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business. Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old, married, and has two children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid back seventeen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from dried fish vending.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married with five children. She is 56 years old and lives in Villa M. Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Aida sells peanuts to earn a living and has had this business for twenty-two years. Each month she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more peanuts so she can earn a living.

Aida has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more peanuts.

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора 37-летняя женщина, семейная и имеет 4х детей.Замужем за молодым мужчиной Абдурашидом. Основным делом занимается откормом скота и продажей молока и кисло-молочных продуктов.В основном держит дойную корову и сама доит корову,а дети продают изделия соседям и вносят свой вклад в семейный бюджет. Муж Нигоры разнорабочий и по заказу выходит на строительные работы. Первый кредит она использовала на покупку молодой телки и откормила и с тех пор это корова дает им молоко  и хороший доход. На очередной кредит она собирается купить еще одну корову, так как спрос на молочные изделия растут. Она рада,что сотрудничает с нашей организацией и может положится на нашу финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Nigora is a 37 year-old married woman, who has four children.  She is married to a young man, Abdurashid.  Her primary business is fattening up livestock and selling milk and dairy products.  Nigora mainly keeps a dairy cow and milks it by herself, and then her children sell products to the neighbors; thus, adding their contribution to the family budget.  Nigora's husband is a handyman and is contracted to do construction work.  Nigora used her first loan to buy a young heifer, fattened it up, and since then, this cow has been giving them milk and a good income.  She plans to use this loan to buy another cow because the demand for dairy products is growing.  Nigora is glad that she is working with our organization and can rely on our financial support.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1976 à Bamako, Madame KOROTOUMOU est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille  polygame dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  Du à des problèmes de famille, elle a prématurément abandonné l’école et s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  la vente de tissus wax et autres depuis 20 ans auprès de sa maman.  Sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit des commandes à travers des associations féminines lors des cérémonies et surtout à l’approche des fêtes.  
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a un an.  Elle est à son 2 eme prêt  individuel.  Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt,  15 pièces de tissus wax et 5 tissus brodés à Bamako. KOROTOUMOU vend en ambulant dans les différentes structures professionnelles de Koutiala et dans sa domicile à une clientèle de femmes et d’hommes au comptant et à crédit payable mensuellement. 
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA avec ce prêt, qu’elle  envisage utiliser pour le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso,  subvenir aux besoins familiaux et élargir son activité avec le reste. 
Ambitieuse, Madame KOROTOUMOU a pour perspective d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de tissus et d’autres produits au grand marché de koutiala.
texts.en:
Mrs. Korotoumou was born in Bamako in 1976. She is married and the mother of four children. She lives in a polygamous family in the city of Koutiala, in the region of Sikasso. Forced to quit school early on due to family problems, she started to earn a living 20 years ago by selling wax and other fabrics with her mother. Her good reputation had enabled her to get orders through women’s groups at local ceremonies and for upcoming celebrations. 

She joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago to meet the needs of a growing customer base. This is her second individual loan, and she will use it to buy 15 pieces of wax fabric and 5 pieces of embroidered fabric in Bamako. She sells door to door in the various office buildings of Koutiala and from her home, for cash or on credit payable monthly, to a clientele consisting of both men and women.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 90,000 CFAF, which she will use to repay her loan, to provide for the needs of her family, and to expand her activity. An ambitious woman, she would like to open a shop where she would sell fabrics and other items at the big market of Koutiala.

loans.use: to buy wax and other fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johanna  de 28 años vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 6 años, ella es consultora de productos  como detalles del hogar, dulces, accesorios  y adornos. Cuando inició esta actividad lo hizo por el deseo de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y esto es justamente lo que ha logrado, además de superarse como mujer, pues con su negocio   aumentó su calidad de vida y  la economía de su hogar;  su meta  mas adelante es tener su propia casa y aumentar sus ganancias, pero en la medida en que su clientela crecen, su propio capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograrlo, así mismo cuando compra productos en promoción sus ganancias son muy buenas y sus clientes se sienten satisfechos, porque la mercancía trae buenos precios. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará artículos con descuentos, con los que responderán a sus clientes,  como detalles para regalos, cajas decorativas, dulces y productos plásticos, con ello sus ventas se incrementaran, porque sus clientes han solicitado estos productos que Johnna vende; así que mientras ella gana dinero con sus ventas, sus clientes  están satisfechos con sus compras.
texts.en:
Johanna, 28, lives with her husband and 3 children, ages 1 to 6 years old. She is a product consultant on items such as household articles, sweets, accessories and decorations. When she started this business she did so with the goal of helping her husband with household expenses and this is just what has happened. In addition to excelling as a woman, she has increased her household’s income and quality of life with her business. 

Johanna’s goal in the future is to own her home and increase her income, however to the extent that her customers have increased, her own working capital is insufficient to move forward. When she buys products to promote, her earnings are very good and her customers are satisfied because she sells the merchandise at good prices. 

Currently Johanna is applying for a loan, her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She  will use it to buy articles on discount to meet the demands of her customers. These include gift items, decorative boxes, sweets and plastic products. Her sales will increase because her customers have requested that she sell these items. Consequently, while Johanna earns money with her sales, her customers will be satisfied with their purchases.

loans.use: to buy discount products to meet her customers' demands, such as gift items, decorative boxes, sweets and plastic products.

loans.name: Josita

texts.en:
Josita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Josita has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Josita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Marialen

texts.en:
Marialen is 28 years old and single with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marialen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her store.

She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Marialen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre de 31 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su servicio de transportación urbana tricimoto su historia comenzó cuando antes trabajaba alquilando una tricimoto de allí reunió para comprarse y adquirió su propia moto con el crédito anterior compro otro tricimoto, su trabajo lo hace solo todos los días, no tiene dificultades,  no está casado, si tiene 2 hijos, su sueño es mejorar y construir vivienda de concreto. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para comprar otra moto y tener mas ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos is 31 and has great aspirations to grow his business in coming years.  He runs an urban tranport business using a three-wheeled motorcycle, which he used to rent but eventually saved up to buy with a prior loan.  He works every day and has no difficulties in his work.  He is not married but has 2 children, and his dream is to improve and construct a concrete home.  He seeks this loan to buy another motorcycle in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nelly Alejandra

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 38 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comercio su historia comenzó como vendedora de suministros de oficina luego con mi esposo decidimos distribuirlo. 

Ya que conocíamos el mercado y nos va muy bien, trabaja con su esposo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, no tiene dificultades, si está casada su esposo la ayuda en el negocio, tiene 3 hijos, su sueño es tener un local ya que mi negocio es en mi casa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar papeleria, perforadoras, plumas y asi vender mas variedad.
texts.en: Nelly is 38 and has great aspirations to grow her business in the future.  Her story began as a saleswoman of office supplies; later with her husband she decided to distribute these supplies, since they knew the market well.  The business has been going very well, and she works with her husband from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. with no difficutlies.  Nelly is married and her husband helps her with the business; she has 3 children and her dream is to open her own store, since now she must run the business from home.  She plans to use this credit to buy paper, pens, hole punches and varied items for resale.

loans.use: buy paper, pens, and other varied items.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Ханифа пожилая женщина, имеет восемь взрослых детей, которые имеют свои домохозяйства. Сама Ханифа сейчас на пенсии с мужем Абдукодиром и воспитывают внуков. Также они присматривают за скотом, часть которых купили на наш кредит и на свои сбережения, таким образом она увеличивает свой скот.Кроме скота в семье занимаются выращивают сельхозкультуру в своем  огороде и продают на рынке.После каждого кредита Ханифа улучшает свои бытовые условия,помогая сыновьям построила дом, женила последнего сына и провела семейное мероприятие.Она благодарна Арванду, что мы предлагаем такие услуги и в дальнейшем намерена продолжать с нами сотрудничать.
texts.en: Hanifa is an elderly woman with eight children, all of whom have their own households.  She is currently retired together with her husband, Abdukodir, and they are raising their grandchildren.  They also look after livestock, some of which they purchased with our loan and her savings, and were, thus, able to increase their livestock quantity.  Besides livestock, the family is involved in growing agricultural crops on their land, which they sell at a market.  After each loan, Hanifa improves her household conditions, helped her sons to build a house, married off her last son and held a family event.  She is grateful to Arvand because we provide such services, and intends to continue working with us in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Gulzoda

texts.ru: Гулзода замужем 4 года, к сожалению у нее нет детей. Ее муж очень любит ее и поддерживает в бизнесе. Он каждые 4-5 месяцев уезжает в Российскую федерацию и присылает ей деньги.  Все это время она жила с мужем у родителей. Но получив кредит на увеличение поголовья скота и получив не плохую прибыль приобрели небольшой дом. Спустя 2 года она переехала в свой дом. Гулзода кредитуется в нашей организации с 2008 года. Ей необходимо увеличить поголовья скота, поэтому она получила у нас кредит что бы купить несколько голов коз.
texts.en: Gulzoda has been married for four years, but, unfortunately, has no children.  Her husband loves her very much and supports her in the business.  He leaves to go to the Russian Federation every 4-5 months and sends her money.  All this time, she lived with her husband in the parents' house, but they were able to purchase a small house after obtaining a loan to increase livestock headcount and making a good profit.  She moved to her house after two years.  Gulzoda has been working with our organization since 2008.  She needs to increase livestock headcount, and this is why she obtained a loan from us to buy several heads of goats.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Sadida

texts.ru: Садиде 39 лет, воспитывает троих детей с мужем Толибом, семья занимается откормом скота и сезонными работами.Садида постоянно держит скот так как в сельских районах это основной доход и средство существования.Её муж в весеннее время уходит на заработки за пределы города, сама Садида едет на прополку в сезон вместе с взрослыми детьми. Она услышала о нашей программе у своих родственников и решила  тоже получить кредит и увеличить поголовье скота.Ей понравилось  работать с нами и продолжает сотрудничать с нами. На предыдущий кредит  Садида купила два бычка и откормила их несколько месяцев и сейчас тоже хочет купить еще два молодых бычка так как они хорошо растут и откармливаются.
texts.en: Sadida is 39 years old and raising three children with her husband, Tolib.  The family is involved in fattening up livestock and seasonal work.  Sadida always keeps livestock because this is the primary source of income and living in rural districts.  Her husband leaves for work outside the city limits in the spring time, and Sadida travels with her adult children for weeding during the season.  She heard about our program from her relatives and decided to also obtain a loan and increase her livestock headcount.  She liked working with us and continues to partner with us.  Sadida used her previous loan to buy two bulls, fattened them up for several months and now wants to also buy two more young bulls because they fatten up and grow well.

loans.use: to buy two bulls

loans.name: Ben (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Ben est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tel que le bois de chauffe, les légumes et du savon.  Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Fatoumata, deuxième à partir de la droite  est le membre du groupe Ben qui vend exclusivement du bois de chauffe.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe dans les villages environs : Kapala, Gouintina et Finkoloni. Elle vend  en gros et en détail au comptant  à la maison à  une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les membres du groupe Ben comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Fatoumata compte réaliser 55 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour éviter les ruptures de stocks de bois de chauffe.
texts.en:
Ben is a group of women from Koutiala who are close friends and who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. Each of them is married with at least three children, and the average age of the group is 34 years old.

These women sell various items such as firewood, vegetables, and soap. To expand their business, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's credit program. This is their first group loan.

Fatoumata, second from the right, is the member of the Ben group who sells exclusively firewood.

She plans to use her loan to buy cartloads of firewood from the neighboring villages: Kapala, Gouintina, and Finkoloni. She sells her firewood both wholesale and retail for cash from her home to a diverse customer base.

While the other members of the Ben group expect to earn, on average, a profit of 45,000 FCFA each over the course of this loan cycle, Fatoumata expects to earn 55,000 FCFA.

In addition to paying back their loans, part of the revenue is used to cover everyday family expenses. They hope to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to avoid disruptions in their firewood supply.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Maria Gladys

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo y no tiene hijos, cuentan con una casa propia ubicada en el caserío rural de “Guaraguaos Alto Lote 115” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande el mismo que esta a unas horas de la provincia de Piura. Caserío en el cual sus habitantes solo se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería a la vez.

Por ahora Maria ha creído conveniente implementar un pequeño negocio de venta comida al paso como: salchipas, salchipollo entre otros, pues ella se dedica a dicho negocio los días viernes, sábados y domingos debido que son los días que mas clientela atrae, su conyugue ayuda a generar ingresos económicas al hogar dedicándose a la agricultura para lo que ha arrendado un terreno en el cual ha sembrado arroz y maíz paralelamente dedicándose de manera diaria dar su mantenimiento y cuidado respectivo.

Maria tiene la necesidad de comprar una refrigeradora para el almacenamiento y mantenimiento de sus insumos para evitar que se pierdan y le puedan traer perdidas a su negocio, por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2500 Nuevos Soles con los que realizara la compra del artefacto.

Pues se sabe que Maria es un cliente responsable debido a sus pagos puntuales en sus anteriores créditos a nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Maria is a 43 year old woman who lives with her husband and does not have children. They own their home, located in the rural settlement of  Guaraguaos Alto Lote 115, belonging to Tambogrande District, which is several hours from Piura Province. The settlement’s inhabitants both farm and raise cattle.

Nowadays Maria has found it profitable to start a small business selling food as a street vendor. She sells “salchipapas” (fried potatoes served with hotdogs and sauces) and  “salchipollo” (fried potatoes served with fried chicken and sauces) among other dishes. She works at her business on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, since these are the days that attract most customers. Her husband helps generate household income by farming and has leased land on which he has planted rice and corn. He farms every day, maintaining and tending his crops. 

Maria needs to buy a refrigerator to store and keep her supplies so she will not lose them and incur losses in her business. Consequently she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,500 nuevos soles in order to purchase this item. 

We know that Maria is a responsible client due to the prompt repayments of her previous loans to our institution.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Sikirathou Alakè

texts.fr: Agée de 27 ans, Sikirathou est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a un stand dans lequel elle vend des tenues prêt à porter et lingeries. Elle a sollicité un financement auprès de Finadev en vue d'accroître son stock et de maximiser son profit pour son bien-être et celui de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Sikirathou is 27 years old, she is married and the mother of one child. She has a stall where she sells ready-to-wear outfits and lingerie.

She requested financing from Finadev in order to increase her stock and to maximize her profit for her and her little family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase 5 dozens pieces of mid-priced lingerie, 2 dozens women's tights and a few ready-to-wear outfits.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.3
El socio es el Sr. Jorge Eduardo; el tiene 47 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesor del nivel universitario y también se dedica en sus tiempos libres a la agricultura, el es propietario de un terreno donde cultiva papa, maíz y verduras y luego los vende en forma independiente, el socio quiere construir su casa. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para construir su casa. 
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Señor Pasión Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Jorge Eduardo, is 47 years old and married with three children.  He alternates his daily activities with his job as a university professor, and also works in agriculture in his spare time.  He is the owner of a plot of land where he grows potatoes, corn, and vegetables and then sells them independently.

He wants to build his house.  He requested the loan to buy construction materials to build his house.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build his house.

loans.name: Djidja (Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Djidja est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tel  les habillements les légumes  du savon et des poissons fumés.  
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. Diarra assise au milieu est le membre du groupe qui vend  des poissons fumés de toutes sortes : carpe, silure, sardine etc.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5  gros paniers de poisson auprès des grossistes. Elle vend en détail au comptant  à la maison et au marché à  une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Diarra compte réaliser 65 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Diarra souhaite renforcer son partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour qu’elle  devienne grossiste.
texts.en:
Djidja is a group of women from Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are all married with at least five children, and the average age of the group in 32 years old.

These women sell various items such as clothing, vegetables, soap, and smoked fish.

In order to expand their business, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's credit program. This is their first group loan. Diarra, seated in the middle, is the group member who sells smoked fish of all varieties: carp, catfish, sardines, etc.

She plans to use her loan to buy 5 large baskets of fish from wholesalers. She sells her fish retail for cash both from her home and at the market to a wide range of customers.

While the other group members expect to earn, on average, a profit of 50,000 FCFA each over the course of the loan cycle, Diarra expects to earn 65,000 FCFA.

In addition to repaying their loans, part of the revenue is used to cover everyday family expenses. Diarra hopes to strengthen her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that she can become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Gnambossou Gbeta 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 4 est composé de seize personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Clémence est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Clémence a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Clémence est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clémence vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Clémence mène comme activité depuis huit ans la vente de maïs et de tissus à son domicile. Clémence s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Clémence sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 4, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. le premier crédit a été bien remboursé
texts.en:
The GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 4 group is made up of 16 people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that this group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their activity.

Clémence, the group's representative, is the woman with her hand raised in the photo. Clémence discontinued her studies at the secondary school level. Clémence is 43 years old and is married to a man named Louis. The couple has four children, all of whom attend school and are in their care. Clémence lives with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses.

To do so, Clémence has been selling corn and fabrics from her home for the past eight years. Clémence gets her supplies from the market in Benin. Striving to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and revenue, Clémence is seeking a second loan from ALIDé along with the other members of the GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 4 group. The first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn

loans.name: Gnambossou Gbeta 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 3 est composé de onze  membres qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Roucharatou Victorine, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Roucharatou Victorine est âgée de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Roucharatou Victorine ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a un enfant qui est scolarisé et vivant à sa charge. Roucharatou Victorine assure seule les diverses charges de son enfant. Roucharatou Victorine a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Roucharatou Victorine fait  de la restauration depuis une quinzaine d’année. Roucharatou Victorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Roucharatou Victorine et les autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 3 sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Gnambossou Gbeta 3 group is composed of 11 members who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of this group, named Roucharatou Victorine, has her hand raised on the photo.

In order to increase their level of activity to better meet their customers’ demand, this group is requesting ALIDé’s financial assistance for the second time.

Roucharatou Victorine is 48 years old and lives in Benin. She no longer lives with her husband but has a child who attends school and is her dependent. She, alone, takes care of the various expenses for her child. She stopped attending school at the secondary level. To provide for her needs and those of her child, Roucharatou Victorine has been providing food preparation for the last 15 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

In order to strengthen their activity and to better meet their customers’ demand, Roucharatou Victorine and the other members of the group Gnambossou Gbeta 3 are requesting a loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase the level of their activity.

loans.use: purchase beverages and condiments for the food.

loans.name: Ma. Emelda

texts.en:
Ma. Emelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her clothes business.

Ma. Emelda has been in this business for 6 years. She earns more income from food vending and a general store.

Ma. Emelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.en:
The Fatima group consists of four people who are friends from the same village. They live in Aden, Yemen. This is the second time that the group is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to increase the member's activity level.
 
Fatima is the leader of the group (she is on the right side of the photograph wearing glasses and covering her face with her hand). She is 40 years old and lives in Aden. She is married and has a son who attends school and whom she financially supports. She jointly takes care of the various household expenses. In order to contribute to these expenses, she has been selling clothes as well as incense, in her own region, for two years. 
 
She requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy her supplies of incense and fabrics in one of the regions of Aden In order to meet her customers' needs, and to increase her turnover and income. 

In the future, she hopes to join her son in the university in order to benefit him and help her.

loans.use: to buy incense and fabrics for her business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 24, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey). She is a homemaker. Her husband is a Tuk Tuk driver who earns approximately USD 9 per day. In order to improve her family living conditions, Touch is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a squeezing machine to squeeze sugarcane to get juice to sell. This purchase would enable her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to sqeeze sugarcane to get juice to sell

loans.name: Leak

texts.en: Leak, 32, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey). For over two years, she has been selling pictures drawn by her husband earning approximately USD 20 per day. Since they don't have an appropriate place to run the business, Leak is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to rent a house for her husband to draw pictures and to be used as a painting shop. In the future, she would like to rent a store in the market for selling her husband’s painting and other souvenirs and support her children to study at a higher level. Moreover, she plans to buy a new house that is not in the APSARA authority location.

loans.use: to rent a house for her husband to draw pictures and to be used as a painting shop

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is a 60-year-old married man from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a farmer and fisherman. Bonifacio works hard to provide for his family. He owns a fishing boat that he operates to catch fish. Bonifacio also owns land that he tills to grow rice crops to sell. Bonifacio plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers, fishing nets and hooks.

In the future, Bonifacio hopes to have his own capital to expand his businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fishing nets and hooks

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 51 years old and married with six children.

Arsenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Arsenia has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Arsenia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her store.

Vilma has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college end improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lis

texts.en: Lis, 20, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey). She and her husband have been working as construction workers for over six years, earning approximately USD 7 per day. Due to the difficulty of traveling to work, Lis is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business to be a construction foreman and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Evita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Evita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used shoes in the Philippines and also earns additional income from salt retail. Evita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more used shoes to sell to customers.

Evita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Brenda

texts.en:
Ma. Brenda works hard to support her family. Ma. Brenda is married and has a rope making business in the Philippines.

Ma. Brenda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her rope making business.

Ma. Brenda has been in this business for 14 years now, and earns additional income from her sari-sari store.

In the future, Ma. Brenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making business.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 62 years old and a widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marylou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Marylou has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soap, shampoo, spices, etc. 

In the future, Marylou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
Chy is 46 years old and a humble resident of Prey Chor district, where she produces rice alongside her husband on a medium-size inherited piece of fertile land. Together, they are able to generate an income of $10.00 per day. This couple has been blessed with only a lovely kid. 

With the amount she requested from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, Chy wants to purchase an additional plot of land to expand her rice farming business. In the coming season, Chy hopes to make a good harvest and thereby increase her financial solvency.

loans.use: to purchase an additional plot of land

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde works hard to support her family. Matilde is married and has a Clinic in the Philippines.

Matilde requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for maintenance of the clinic.

Matilde has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Matilde would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the clinic maintenance

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 39 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Merlita works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Merlita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, spices, soap, etc. 

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
As a married parent of 11 children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Tessie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Mae Joy

texts.en:
Mae Joy is 32 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mae Joy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mae Joy has been raising pigs for seven years and earns additional income from rice retailing and tricycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 47 years old and married.

Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Edna has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and earns additional income from tricycle transportation.

Edna aspires to save enough money to put up a grocery store in a public market.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Sariatou Adébo Vivienne

texts.fr: Sariatou a 34 ans et a 2 enfants à charge. Elle a une boutique à domicile dans laquelle elle vend des divers. Elle  fait appel au concours financier de Finadev pour mieux achalander son commerce afin de gagner un public plus large.
texts.en: Sariatou is 34 years old and has two children in her care.  She holds a shop in her house, where she sells various grocery items.  She is requesting financial assistance from Finadev to offer a broader variety of goods and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy 1 tray of eggs, 1 box of spaghetti, 1 box of soap, 1 carton of seasoning cubes, 1 dozen Nescafé boxes, 1 dozen milk cartons, 1/2 dozen boxes of Lipton tea and 1 carton of sugar.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 45 years old and lives in Centro Hulpa, Tudela. Emma is married with five children. 

To earn a living, Emma has a business selling baked goods. Emma earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Emma has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter, etc.
.
Emma has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Emma would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria works hard to support her family. Asteria is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Asteria requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fishing gear and other equipment.

Asteria has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Asteria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 60 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pablita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Pablita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Pablita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Pablita would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ma. Hanel-Len

texts.en:
Ma. Hanel-len works hard to support her family. Ma. Hanel-len is single and has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines.

Ma. Hanel-len requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and materials needed for her manicure.

Ma. Hanel-len has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Ma. Hanel-len would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials needed for her manicure.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is married with two children. Nellie is 40 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela.

Nellie is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Nellie has been doing this for two years. Nellie has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for raising pigs.
 
Nellie has been a member of PMPC for six months. In the future, Nellie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 36 years old and lives in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela. Salome is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Salome has a business selling snacks. Salome earns about PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. Salome has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, oil, etc. for making food delicacies.

Salome has been a member of PMPC for six months.  In the future, Salome would like to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, oil, etc

loans.name: Chroek

texts.en:
Chroek is 58 years old and a good mother of two children. She generates a living by being involved in an agricultural business. She owns a few hectares of farmland for growing her rice products, earning approximately $10.00 per day. Her husband helps her manage almost every part of this business.

As of now, Chroek would like to acquire some funds from Kiva, through HKL to purchase a pumping machine and fertilizer to provide her crops good growth in the coming season. Her business plan is to further develop her existing business.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine and fertilizer.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Файзулло молодой активный парень,семейный и отец двоих детей. Занимался бизнесом с женой Манзурой в одном  деле, но так как сейчас Манзура воспитывает маленького ребенка,она не выходит на работу. Почти 15 лет Файзулло изготавливает шашлыки (национальное мясное изделие) и в готовом виде продает их  у входа областной больницы, где у него  своё место, как столовая. Это многолюдное место, куда заходят много приезжих и посетителей и ежедневно он реализует более 150 палочек шашлыков и  дополнительно продает рыбу и пиво. В нашу организацию пришел 6 лет назад и с тех пор непрерывно получает кредит на расширение своего бизнеса. Файзулло каждый день закупает сырьё из базара на своей автомашине и его машина очень износилась, требует много затрат каждый день,поэтому  он планирует обновить свою машину, так как  он не может обойтись без неё. Он накопил немного средств и недостающую часть запрашивает у нас в качестве кредита.
texts.en:
Faizullo is an active young guy and a family man with two children. He and his wife Manzura were engaged in the same business, but as Manzura is raising their small child, she is not currently working. For almost 15 years Faizullo has been making kebabs (a traditional meat dish) and selling them ready-to-eat near the entrance to the local hospital, where he has his diner-like spot. It's a crowded place with many visitors, and Faizullo sells over 150 kebabs daily, while also serving fish and beer. 

Faizullo first came to MDO Arvand, LLC six years ago, and since then has been taking loans continuously to expand his business. Every day Faizullo purchases raw ingredients at the market using his car. The vehicle has become worn out and requires daily expenditures, so Faizullo is planning to buy a new car as he cannot do without one. He has saved up some money on his own, and is requesting this loan to cover the balance.

loans.use: to buy a new car for his business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Nenita has been in this business for five years. Nenita earns more income from her general store.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 65 years old and lives in Sebac, Tudela. Isabel is married with four children. 

Isabel has a store that sells a variety of products. Isabel has had this business for 15 years. Isabel requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional products such as noodles, beverages, canned goods, detergents, etc.
  .
Isabel has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Isabel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as noodles, beverages, canned goods, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is a 50-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has eight children between 4 and 23 years old.

Cirilo has had his bus transportation business for more than 10 years. Cirilo earns 10,000 PHP with his business. He works hard to feed his family and send his children to school. Cirilo plans to use his loan to purchase tires and spare parts. In the future, he hopes to own more buses and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is married with three children. Rosario is 55 years old and lives in Napurog, Tudela.

Rosario is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetables to earn a living. Rosario has been doing this for 10 years. Rosario has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops

loans.name: Gbedokpo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBEDOKPO 1 est composé de onze membres qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Grâce est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé. Grâce est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un certain Ibrahim. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Grâce vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Grâce mène comme activité depuis vingt cinq ans la vente de produits divers, des tubercules et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Grâce s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Grâce sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement GBEDOKPO 1, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The GBEDOKPO 1 group is made up of 11 members who live in the same neighborhood. It is the second time that the group is requesting financial support from ALIDé.  Grâce, the facilitator of the group, is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 45 years old and married to a man named Ibrahim.  The couple has three children who all attend school.  Two of their children are their dependents.  Grâce lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.  To this end, and for the past 25 years, Grâce has been selling various products such as tubers and charcoal, from her home.  She stocks up at a market in Benin. She is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the GBEDOKPO 1 group, in order to meet her customers' needs and increase her turnover and income.  The first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy tubers and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ana Yansy

texts.es: Ana Yansy, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casada,  vive con sus  hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar los insumos para asistir su granja donde tiene cerdos y pollos. Ella actualmente cuenta con una pequeña granja con establecimientos y los tiene con animales pero la asistencia necesita mejorarla para tener sus animales aptos para la venta al mercado de la localidad y aumentar ganancias con la venta. Ella con las ganancias quiere hacerle a su esposo las responsabilidades de la casa menores y tener así una estabilidad económica  mejor cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ana Yansy, 30, is married and lives with her husband and kids who are her top priority. With the loan she will buy inputs for her farm where she has pigs and chickens. Currently she has a small farm with buildings and animals but she needs help to improve it so that she can get her animals ready for sale and increase her profits. With the earnings she wants to decrease her husband's responsibilities around the house and increase their financial stability every day. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan easily and with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to have a farm with pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs for cabbage culture.

loans.name: Rohat
