Verónica pertenece al grupo  alelí el cual esta integrado por  10 personas las cuales todas son mujeres a continuación serán mencionadas: Victorina, María, Guadalupe, Zoila, Reina, Julita, Yolanda, Esther y Rufina, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de productos de abarrotes, dulces, frutas y verduras, carne, pan, comida, etc.
texts.en:
Verónica is 30 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.  Ángel is in his first year of high school and Magali is in her third year.  Verónica's husband is called Joaquín and he is an agricultural worker.

Verónica owns a grocery store which she has had for four months.  She says that it is doing very well and she will invest her loan in buying groceries such as milk, oil, soft drinks, cookies, eggs, etc.  Verónica would like her store to be a little larger but she is also very happy to be doing well and perhaps in the future she will expand it some more.

Verónica belongs to the 'Aleli' group.  This group has 10 members who are all women.  They are: Victorina, María, Guadalupe, Zoila, Reina, Julita, Yolanda, Esther and Rufina.  They all have their own sales businesses including: selling groceries, sweet treats, fruit and vegetables, meat, bread, food, etc.

loans.use: to buy products such as milk, oil, soft drinks, cookies, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Virgen del Carmen” es un grupo conformado por 07 mujeres responsables, siendo Francisca la tesorera del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad. Francisca tiene 52 años de edad,  ella junto a su esposo y 01 hijo aún dependiente vive en el distrito de Matucana. Actualmente  se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes  como arroz, azúcar, fideos entre otros, la cual viaja al centro del país para  venderlos, el dinero que percibe es de mucha ayuda, con esfuerzo y  la ayuda de su esposo ha podido cumplir una de sus metas terminar de construir su vivienda. Su siguiente meta es de  instalar una bodega donde pueda ofrecer productos de primera necesidad. Este crédito le servirá para comprar arroz, azúcar y fideos  y así poder viajar para venderlos. La Alcancía Comunal “Virgen del Carmen” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado. Francisca está ubicada al lado derecho, viste una casaca blanca y pantalón marón.
texts.en: The 'Virgen del Carmen' community bank is made up of seven responsible women.  Francisca is the group's treasurer, a role that she has carried out responsibly.  Francisca is 52 years old.  She lives in Matucana district together with her husband and one child who is still dependent on her.  Her current business is buying and selling groceries such as rice, sugar and noodles.  She travels to the center of the country to sell her products.  The money she makes is very helpful.  Through her own hard work and with her husband's help, she has been able to achieve one of her goals which was to finish building her home.  Her next goal is to set up a grocery store where she can sell basic household products.  This loan will enable her to buy rice, sugar and noodles, and she will be able to travel to sell them.  The members of the 'Virgen del Carmen' community bank are grateful for the loan they are receiving.  Francisca is on the right-hand side of the picture wearing a white jacket and brown trousers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

Julieta has a business buying and selling frozen food products in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from food vending and from farming rice. Julieta is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her frozen food products business.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 46-year-old widow blessed with five children, whose ages are 25, 23, 20, 15 and 13. She has a business of selling secondhand clothes, which she ventured into 11 years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

Beatrice has requested a loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase bales of jumpers, skirts and t-shirts for sale. 

The profit Beatrice earns from this business will help her educate her children and build more rental houses. Her dream is to see her business expand and meet the needs of her family. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of jumpers, skirts and t-shirts for sale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa de 56 años es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 28 y 36 años y se dedica al comercia de productos cosméticos desde hace 10 años en el departamento del Atlántico, así como lo hacia cuando vivió en la capital del país y se dedicaba a esta misma actividad. En la actualidad Teresa vive con su cónyuge   pues sus dos hijos están radicados en otras ciudades de Colombia mientras ellos generan ingresos a parir de su propio negocio vendiendo perfumes y legumbres en un mercado compuesto por amas de casa y pequeños negocios, a quienes les vende de contado y a crédito. Como cada día su clientela crece, su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responderle oportunamente a todos sus compradores, por eso ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará legumbres, mercancías variadas como cosméticos perfumes, y otras mercancías que en esta oportunidad trae las revistas especializada de productos, mediante la cual promociona lo que vende. Con su credikiva logrará una inversión exitosa, porque lo hace sobre pedidos,  que garantizan una rotación rápida de sus ventas y con descuentos especiales que agregan valor a su venta. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia casa y para disminuir los gastos de arriendo del hogar y disfrutar de mayor sosiego familiar.
texts.en: 56-year-old Teresa is a married woman who has two children aged 28 and 36.  She has been selling cosmetics in Atlántico department for 10 years and used to carry out the same business when she lived in the country's capital city.  Teresa currently lives together with her husband as her two children are living in other cities in Colombia.  She makes income from her own business selling perfume and vegetables to a market consisting of housewives and small businesses.  She makes her sales for cash and on credit.  As her customer base continues to grow, her working capital is not enough to respond to her buyers in a timely manner.  For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan (her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to buy vegetables and a variety of merchandise including cosmetics and perfume.  She has specialized product catalogs which she uses to promote and sell her products.  Teresa will make a successful investment with her Kiva loan because she sells to order.  This guarantees her a quick sales turnover and she enjoys special discounts which makes her more profits on her sales.  Her goal for the future is to own her own home so that she can reduce her rental expenses and live more peacefully with her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Liza has been in this business for 10 years. Liza earns additional income from raising livestock.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, age 47, is from Nakuru. She is married and has one son who is in primary school.

Susan was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy animal feed to add to her stock.

In the future, Susan hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Nakuru area.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin, age 54, is married and has one daughter. He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop.  Elchin has nine years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products Elchin sells are very popular among the people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 250 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in his shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location, which is in the central bazaar of his home city.

Elchin would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in his business. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 500 AZN. He will purchase additional foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
La Sra.Gricelda es de Ciudad del este, está  casada, tiene dos  hijos, quienes ya son todos mayores de edad y trabajan de forma independiente.
Ella tiene una pequeña despensa, cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.  Con la ayuda de su esposo y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir trabajado y creciendo.
texts.en:
Gricelda is from Ciudad del Este.  She is married and has two children who are both adults and work independently.

Gricelda has a small grocery store.  Her sales are increasing and making her a good income.  With the help of her husband and her whole family, she is getting ahead in life with a lot of sacrifice and hard work.  Gricelda is now a successful micro-businesswoman and she has a loyal and large customer base as a result of her kindness.

Gricelda has shown herself to be a responsible and honest person as regards her obligations so we must give her all the support she needs.  She is requesting a loan to buy food products, drinks, dairy products and other items she needs so that she can continue to work and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy food products, drinks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
n  la  ciudad de Caaguazú, 10 señoras humildes formaron un comité con el fin de obtener un crédito para seguir trabajando, para un mejor porvenir de sus familias. Con la esperanza puesta de poder alcanzar sus metas, confiaron en la Fundación Paraguaya para el logro de este gran objetivo.
Romelia, es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de leche por todo su barrio y nos comenta que por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familiares a tener una mejor vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder tener en stock su producto. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que les da.
texts.en:
In the city of Caaguazú, ten unassuming ladies came together and set up a committee so that they could obtain a loan which would enable them to keep working towards a better future for their families.  With the hope of achieving their goals, they trusted in Fundación Paraguaya to help them.

Romelia is one of this group's members.  Her business is selling milk around her neighborhood.  She tells us that this work has enabled her to do well and help her family members to enjoy a better life.

Romelia is requesting a loan to buy milk so that she can stock her business.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy milk to re-sell

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty es el grupo que está integrado por 16 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas y decidieron formar un grupo, para que de esa forma puedan trabajar en conjunto y ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder mejorar sus estilos de vida y el de sus familias. Son mujeres luchadoras que se esfuerzan día a día.
Angela tiene una pequeña despensa,comenta que es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que diariamente empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ya que desde esas horas ya tiene clientes aguardando. Gracias a su trabajo y a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Angela acude a la fundación y a kiva para la compra de panificados, lácteos, arroz y demás insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
'Kuña Aty' is a group with 16 members who are all women from the city of Caaguazú.  They are friends and neighbors who decided to form a group so that they could work together and help each other to improve their own lifestyles as well as those of their families.  They are tenacious women who work hard every day.

Angela has a small grocery store.  She says that she is a very hard-working and tenacious woman who starts work very early each morning as when she opens her store she already has customers waiting.  Thanks to her hard work and effort, she has been able to do well and help her family.

Angela came to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for a loan to buy baked goods, dairy products, rice and other items she needs to stock her business.  This will enable her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, dairy products, rice, etc.

loans.name: Rayimtaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme ADAMA est la représentante du groupe RAYIMTAABA. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans le moins âgé a 13ans. 03 de ses enfants vont a l’école et elle a 05 personnes à sa charge.

Mme est tisseuse. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de  cissin en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  01 balle de fils de tisse et 01kg de teinture.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne devenir une grande productrice de pagnes tissés et dans le long terme (vieillesse) vendre les fils de tisse et aider son mari pour l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. ADAMA is the representative of the group RAYIMTABA. She is married and the mother of seven children. The eldest is 27 and the youngest is 13 years old, and three of them go to school. She has five dependents. 

Adama is a weaver. She has been practicing this profession for five years. She buys her merchandise at the Cissin market, in the city. Her clientele is composed of both men and women.

Adama wants to buy one bale of weaving yarn and 1 kg of dye. 

Her profits go towards her savings. She would like to become a major maker of pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) and in the long term, as she grows older, she plans to sell weaving yarn and help her husband with the children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one bale of weaving yarn and 1 kg of dye.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora  Marta quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Las demás amigas encantadas decidieron formar parte de este proyecto y se encuentran muy felices.
La sra. Marta trabaja como costurera y hace venta de joyas de plata desde hace un tiempo, esta separada hace 3años, tiene cuatro  hijos menores, que aun dependen de ella y uno mayor de edad que ya es independiente.  Comenta que todo el trabajo que ella hace es por su familia, ya que desea poder darles todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
Ella solciita el crédito para poder comprar telas e hilos, como asi tambien joyas con lo cual podrá tener más productos en stock para sus clientes. El grupo entero está muy agradecido con la fundacion por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The contact person who set up this committee was Marta.  She invited her friends to join the 'Entrepreneurial Women's Committee' program.  Her friends were keen to join the project and they are very happy.

Marta works as a seamstress and has also been selling silver jewelry for some time.  She has been separated for three years.  She has four dependent children and one child who is already an adult and independent.  She says that all the work she does is for her family as she would like to be able to give them everything they need so that they can enjoy a life without hardships.

Marta is requesting this loan to buy fabric and thread.  She will also buy jewelry which will enable her to have more products in stock for her customers.  The whole group is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the help that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread, and also jewelry to sell

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.es:
La Señorita Yohanna  es cliente de la fundación desde el año 2009, actualmente cuenta con dos créditos vigentes y es una excelente clienta.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas para damas y niños que trae exclusivamente de  Argentina, cuenta que viaja 4 veces al mes para poder surtir su negocio con ropas de temporada y por sobre todo de buena calidad y con bajo costo. La mayoría de sus clientes  son Empleados  de empresas reconocidas  en el mercado, es decir que tiene como un ingreso seguro.  Dice que gracias a Dios le va muy bien, y quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, ya que quiere estar abastecida para ofrecer buena variedad a sus clientes.
Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por la confianza brindada en los créditos.
texts.en:
Yohanna has been a client of Fundación Paraguaya since 2009.  She has received two loans and is an excellent client.

Yohanna's business is buying and selling ladies' and children's clothing which she gets from Argentina.  She says that she travels four times a month to stock her business with seasonal clothing.  The clothing that she buys is good quality and also cheap.  Most of her customers work in well-known companies which means that they have a steady income.  Yohanna says that, thanks to God, her business is doing very well and she would like to continue investing in it.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothing as she would like to stock her business so that she can offer her customers a good variety of clothing.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the confidence that they place in her with their loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Ya Nere Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA est la responsable du groupe  YA NERE. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans le moins âgé a 04mois. Les 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des pagnes  depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  15 pièces de pagnes.

Avec  ses bénéfices, elle  contribue à la scolarisation de ses enfants et aide ses proches (sœur, frère etc.). Mme ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin  de pagne.
texts.en:
Haoua is the Ya Nere group leader. She is married and the mother of 4 children aged between 12 years and 4 months. Two of the children go to school and Haoua is responsible for 6 people.

Haoua has been selling pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African fabric) for 10 years and she gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town. Her customers are both women and men.

Haoua would like to buy 15 pieces of pagnes. She uses her profits to contribute to her children´s educational expenses and to help her loved ones (sister, brother etc.). She would one day like to open a large shop selling pagnes.

loans.use: to buy 15 pieces of pagnes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr:
La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire «Tosheka », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 46  ans, mariée, mère de 8 jeunes enfants, dont seulement 4 étudient. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est  vendeuse de fretins localement  appelés (Sambaza). Il y a  10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  8eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2  basins de 20 kg de Fretins.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. 
`
texts.en: The client, leader of the business group Tosheka, is an entrepreneur, 46 years old, married, mother of eight year children of whom four are studying. Her husband is unemployed. She works selling minnows, locally called Sambaza. Over ten years have gone by since she started working in small revenue generating businesses like this. However, she just obtained her eighth loan from Hekima. This new loan must be used for her to stock up with two 20 kg basins of minnows. Additionally, she wishes to see her children grow up comfortably and increase her business. The client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from regular banks.

loans.use: to pay for two 20 kg basins of minnows

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie est une femme âgé(e) de 47 ans. Elle est mariée à un mécanicien. Elle a 05 enfants dont 01 à l’école.
Marie travaille comme revendeuse d’ignames frites depuis 2004. Elle vend seule et achète ses produits à Lomé.
Marie a requis son quatrième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames, de l’huile végétale.  Elle veut épargner. 
Dans les prochaines années, Marie voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Marie is a 47 year old woman. She is married to a mechanic. She has five children, one of whom is in school.
Marie has worked selling fried yams since 2004. She sells alone and buys her products in Lome.
Marie requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to buy yams and vegetable oil. She wants to save up.
In the coming years, Marie would like to grow her business. She says that with the profits, she foresees having a happy family.

loans.use: to buy yams and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou est un homme marié de 36 ans et père de 4 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants à Bougouni. 
En raison à la pauvreté de ses parents, il décide d’abandonner l’école en classe de 4ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) au profit des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi  que pendant des années il  mena plusieurs activités mais sans succès. Alors il commença à s’intéresser aux activités d’achat et la vente de bicyclettes, dans laquelle il finit par se spécialiser. Il a appris cette activité auprès d’un de ses ami. Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans, il maitrise cette activité et il est très apprécié et sollicité.
Dans le souci de satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et exigeante, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé les cinq prêts précédents, il est à son  6ème prêt individuel, qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 25 bicyclettes de différentes sortes (c’est à dire petite, moyenne et grande).
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossiste et effectue ses ventes au grand marché de Bougouni, à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Il espère réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et être réinvesti dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou is 36, married and the father of four children.  He lives with his wife and children in Bougouni.  
Because of his parents’ poverty, he decided to leave school during the fourth year of primary school (in the Malian education system) in order to start earning money.  For years he engaged in different types of work but without success. Then he became interested in buying and selling bicycles, and he eventually specialized in it.  He learned this type of work from one of his friends.  After five years of experience he has mastered this trade and he is highly valued and in demand. 
In order to meet the demand of his growing clientele, he decided to get involved with Soro Yiriwaso.  After having properly repaid his five previous loans, he is on his sixth individual loan with which he plans to buy 25 bicycles of different types (small, medium, and large).
He gets his supplies in Bamako from wholesalers and makes his sales at the main market in Bougouni to a diverse and varied clientele.
He hopes to make, with this loan, a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy bicycles.

loans.name: Badakim

texts.fr:
Badakim est une femme âgé(e) de 43 ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur. Elle a 03 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 14 ans et le dernier a 08 ans.  
Badakim travaille comme revendeuse de céréales et des sacs de charbons de bois depuis 1997. Elle vend seule à la maison à toutes personnes désireuses de s’approvisionner. Sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le marché.
Badakim a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maîs et des charbons de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Badakim voudrait développer son d’autres horizons afin d’ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Badakim is a 43 year old woman. She is married to a welder. She has three children, two of whom are in school. The first is fourteen years old and the youngest is eight years old. Badakim has worked selling grains and bags of charcoal since 1997. She sells alone at the house to anyone wanting to stock up. Her major difficulty is the competition on the market.
Badakim requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy corn and charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Badakim would like to expand her horizons in order to open a store. She says that with the profit, she foresees having a happy family.

loans.use: to buy grains and charcoal.

loans.name: Boyodé

texts.fr:
Boyodé est un homme âgé de 26 ans. Il est célibataire.
Boyodé travaille comme revendeur depuis 2011. Il vend des boissons BB pour tous clients à la maison. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toute sa clientèle.
Boyodé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons BB. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Boyodé voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Boyodé is 26 years old.  He is single.
Boyodé  has worked as a salesman since 2011.  He sells BB drinks to the public from his house.  He buys his products in Lomé.  He works alone.  
At the moment, his main difficulty is satisfying all of his customers. 
Boyodé received his first loan through WAGES in order to buy BB drinks. He wants to reinvest in his business.
In the years to come, Boyodé would like to grow his business. He says that with the profits, he will be be able to meet the vital needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Akua

texts.fr:
Akua est une femme âgé(e) de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire. Elle a  02 enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a 06 ans et le dernier a 03 ans.  
Akua travaille comme revendeuse de denrées alimentaires  depuis 2006. Elle vend à la maison à ses clients et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le marché.
Akua a requis son cinquième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des denrées alimentaires et des céréales. Elle veut épargner. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akua voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Akua is a 26 year old woman. She is married to a military serviceman. She has two children, both in school. The first is six years old and the last is three years old.
Akua has worked selling food items since 2006. She sells to her customers at the house and her difficulty is the competition on the market.
Akua requested her fifth loan from WAGES in order to buy food items and grains. She wants to save.
In the coming years, Akua would like to grow her business. She says that with the profits, she foresees having a happy family.

loans.use: to buy food items and grains.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié å une  couturière. Il a 02 enfants. Le premier a 03ans et le dernier  01an.
Kossi travaille comme revendeur de planches depuis 2008. Il sert ses clients dans un quartier de la place et est aidé par une personne. La difficulté qu’il rencontre est la concurrence sur le marché.
Kossi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des planches destinées à la vente. Il veut réinvestir dans son activité en vue  de son développement meilleur.
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait développer son activité afin d’avoir d’autres points de vente. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Kossi is 32 years old and married to a seamstress. He has 2 children aged between 1 and 3. Kossi has been selling planks since 2008. He serves his customers in a local district and is helped by one other person. The challenge that he faces is the competition on the market.

Kossi has requested his first loan from WAGES so that he can buy some planks for resale. He would like to reinvest in his business in order to better develop it. In the coming years, Kossi would like to expand his business and have more outlets. He foresees using his profits to make his family happy.

loans.use: to buy planks.

loans.name: Las Fantasticas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS FANTASTICAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: fabricación de deportivos, elaboración de mantas, distribuidor de palillos, venta de cosméticos, promotora de YAMBAL, centro de cosméticos, centro de llamadas, tienda de abarrotes. 

La señora Adela indica que es la primera vez que integra en Pro Mujer  ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos YAMBAL que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de productos YAMBAL) que adquirirá a pedido y posteriormente lo comercializará en su domicilio y puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trato hacia las personas.
texts.en:
The communal association "LAS FANTASTICAS" began its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Villa Exaltación. It is made up of eleven members and it is directed by a board of directors where Adela is president. The businesses that the members of the communal association are carrying forward are varied. Among them we have: manufacturing sweatshirts, making blankets, distributing toothpicks, selling cosmetics, YAMBAL promoter, cosmetics center, call center, grocery store.

Adela says that this is the first time that she is a part of Pro Mujer, having joined at the invitation of a friend. Currently she has a business selling YAMBAL cosmetics, and she has been working at this for years.

The loan she will now take out is to grow her business (buying YAMBAL products) which she will acquire by ordering and later sell commercially in her home and point of sale. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family in whatever way possible.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes how they treat people.

loans.use: to buy YAMBAL products.

loans.name: Balentina

texts.es: La señora Balentina se dedica a la venta de comida, almuerzos a al medio día y cena en las tardes, tiene cinco hijos todos son independientes, vive en su domicilio propio, sobre una avenida muy concurrida pasando el cuarto anillo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, se dedica ha esta actividad por mas de 10 años, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Balentina comprar una heladera y un televisor para la pensión y así de esta manera dar un buen servicio a sus clientes y entretenimiento a pesar de sus buenos platillos que ofrece, la Sra. Balentina es una persona muy amable su deseo es poder tener mas clientela y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos la señora Balentina se siente agradecida con la institución por la rapidez y el buen trato recibido.
texts.en: Balentina works in food service, lunch at mid-day and dinner in the evenings. She has five children and all are independent. She lives in her own home, above a very busy avenue passing through the fourth ring [a neighborhood defined by Santa Cruz's circular avenues] of the city of Santa Cruz. She has been in this business for more than ten years. With the money from the loan, Balentina will buy a fridge and a television for the establishment and in this way give good service and entertainment to her customers, apart from the good dishes she offers. Balentina is a very kind person, her wish is to be able to have more customers and in this way grow her income. Balentina feels grateful to the institution for the quickness and good treatment she has received.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a television.

loans.name: Enagnon 7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON 7 est formé de quatre personnes qui appartiennent à un même collectif des artisans de couture. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Julien Nounagnon, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Julien Nounagnon est âgé 50 ans de est marié à une marchande du nom de Rachelle. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En dehors de ses enfants, Julien Nounagnon a un autre enfant à charge. Julien Nounagnon et sa famille habitent ensemble. Julien Nounagnon a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire, au profit de la couture qu’il a appris et qu'il exerce depuis vingt cinq ans. De façon secondaire, Julien Nounagnon vend de l'huile de palme qu'il produit dans sa région. Julien Nounagnon désire acquérir une nouvelle machine à surfiler afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Aussi, Julien Nounagnon désire rehausser le niveau de sa production en huile de palme. Pour se faire, Julien Nounagnon sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON 7. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group ENAGNON 7 consists of four individuals who belong to the same sewing crafts association. The representative of the group is Julien Nounagnon who has his hand raised in the photo. This is the third time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

Julien Nounagnon is 50 years old and married to a merchant named Rachelle. The couple have five children, some of whom attend school. Julien also has another dependent child. Julien and his family all live together. 

Julien Nounagnon attended primary school and then went on to learn to sew, a profession he has been practicing for 25 years. As a sideline he also sells palm oil, which he makes locally. 

Julien Nounagnon wishes to buy a new serging machine to better meet customer demand. He also wants to boost his production of palm oil. To that end, he is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of ENAGNON 7. All past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy a serging machine and some palm nuts.

loans.name: Los Olivos Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo en la ciudad de Caaguazú, son 16 señoras que participan en el comité, son mujeres Humildes y muy trabajadoras que se unieron con el deseo de obtener un pequeño apoyo para continuar trabajando y así mantener a  sus familias. Están actualmente en el 5to. Ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Antonia comenta que por medio de las ventas de bebidas que hace ha podido ayudar a su familia y de esa forma darles lo que necesitan para una vida más cómoda. Dice que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que gracias a las ventas que hace y a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante y crecer como microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en su negocio, pues quiere comprar más bebidas para tenerlo surtido y de esa forma estar con stock frente a la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee (a communal bank) was formed in the city of Caaguazu; 16 women participate in the committee. They are humble and very hard-working women who thus maintain their families. At present, they are in their 5th loan cycle through the “Enterprising Women Program” at the Fundacion Paraguaya (Paraguayan Foundation).

Antonia comments that by selling drinks as she does, she has been able to help her family and, in this way, provide what they need for a more comfortable life. She says she began with a tiny business but, thanks to her sales and her efforts, she has been able to  move ahead and grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business; she wants to buy drinks to have the selection and stock she needs to supply the demands of her customers.

loans.use: buy drinks to restock the business.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos Tiene 27 años, vive acompañado con Noelia. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de colchas, frazadas y demás, lo que aprendió  de su padre con quien empezó a trabajar en el rubro de ventas desde muy pequeño, formando así su grupo de clientela con quien trabaja hasta la actualidad.
Vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá y decidió dedicarse a este rubro ya que cuenta con una experiencia en el mismo y también el buen ingreso que éste le deja. Realiza sus ventas en forma ambulante por Ciudad del Este todos los fines de semanas, acompañado algunas veces por su pareja. Para ello cuenta con una motocicleta que emplea para el traslado de un lugar a otro. Es un hombre trabajador, honesto y emprendedor.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de colchas, sobrecamas, etc., para aumentar su stock de mercaderías, ya que tiene muchos pedidos que cubrir.
texts.en:
27-year old Carlos lives with his partner Noelia. He earns a living selling bedspreads, blankets etc., a business he has been involved in since childhood. Over the years he has developed a customer base with whom he works to this day.

Carlos lives in the town of Carapeguá. He decided to take up this line of work as he had a lot of experience in it, and also because it brought in a good income. He goes around selling the merchandise at weekends in the eastern part of town, sometimes accompanied by Noelia. He uses his motorbike to get from one place to another. Carlos is a hardworking, honest, and enterprising man.

He needs a loan to buy more stock such as bedspreads and bedcovers as he has many orders to fulfill.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bedcovers

loans.name: Gani

texts.ru: Гани 1960 года рождения, он женат у него 5 детей.  Он торгует  на рынке обувью. Его стаж торговли на рынке более 10 лет. Но по несчастью недавно произошел пожар на его прилавке. Сгорело почти половины его вещей. По этому он желает получить новый кредит для восстановления своего товара.  Ему необходимо провести ремонт своего ларька и привезти товар - обувь мужскую, что бы восстановить свой товарооборот и продолжить свою деятельность. Надеется на поддержку от КИВА и АРванд.
texts.en: Gani was born in 1960, he is married and has 5 children. Gani sells footwear at the market and has over 10 years of experience doing this. Unfortunately, a recent fire at his stall destroyed almost half of his merchandise. Gani would like to obtain a new loan to replace the lost goods. He needs to perform repairs on his stall and restock his merchandise (men's shoes) in order to restore his trade and continue his business. Gani is hoping for support from Kiva and MDO Arvand, LLC.

loans.use: to purchase footwear for sale

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El comité fue formado gracias a la gestión de una de las miembros, quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el grupo en la zona. El comité se denomina “Santa Catalina”.  Están  en el Noveno Ciclo, con 14  integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y comprometido con sus responsabilidades.
Zulma es una de las miembros del grupo, ella nos comenta que tiene una librería-mercería, donde vende todo tipo de productos. Comenta que solo empezó con uno de estos negocios, y que después, gracias a su esfuerzo y duro trabajo ha podido crecer e implementar el otro. Su deseo es poder ser una gran microempresaria para poder ayudar así a sus familiares.
Zulma acude a fundación paraguaya y kiva, para solicitar un crédito, el cual desea poder invertir en la compra de cuadernos, lápices y demás insumos de librería, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda
texts.en:
This group was formed when one of the members contacted her neighbours and friends and organised them into a group. It is called Santa Catalina, and the 14-member group is now in its ninth loan cycle. It is well-known locally for being united, committed, and determined to fulfill its responsibilities. 

Zulma is one of the members. She runs a book shop/stationery store where she sells a range of products. She began with one business but then through a lot of effort and hard work the business grew and she opened another store. Her goal is to be a successful businesswoman so she can help her family.

Zulma has approached the Paraguaya Foundation and Kiva to ask for a loan so she can buy notebooks, pencils and other stationery supplies. The loan would be a great help to her.

loans.use: buy notebooks, pencils and other stationery supplies

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa, se formo a partir del contacto con la Sra. Francisca quien es presidenta de su comité vecinal y al enterarse del programa de la fundación paraguaya  invito a sus vecinas para formar parte del comité.
Clara es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, comenta que mediante su trabajo ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Empezó vendiendo prendas a solo unos pocos clientes que tenía, pero gracias a su buena pasta para las ventas ha podido crecer y progresar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de variadas clases, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y mejorando su estilo de vida. Agradecen a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le están dando.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group was formed by Sra. Francisca who is the president. After hearing about the Paraguaya Foundation, she contacted her neighbours and invited them to form a group.

One of the members is Clara, a hardworking and determined woman who through her work has been able to help her family get ahead. She started out selling underwear to some of the few customers she had, but because she is good at selling, the business grew and she did well. Clara is now seeking a loan to buy different kinds of clothing so she can continue with her business and improve her standard of living.

The group members are grateful to the Foundation and Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Eliza

texts.ru:
Элизе 21 год, замужем, воспитывает двухлетнюю дочку.  Элиза занимается откормом и перепродажей скота, начав этот бизнес в 2010 году.   Вложенная сумма в 5,000 сом (KGS) в основание Элизой своего хозяйства на сегодняшний день приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в квартал с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. 
Имея в наличии одну дойную корову и три овцы, Элиза обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Элиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Eliza is 21 years old, married, and is raising a two-year-old daughter. Eliza fattens and resells cattle, having started this business in 2010. The initial investment of 5,000 som (KGS), with which she launched her farm, currently earns approximately 12,000 som (KGS) each quarter from sales of dairy and meat products. Eliza, who currently has one dairy cow and three sheep, has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 45,000 som (KGS) to expand the size of her herd. Eliza plans to use her profits from this loan to further increase the quantity of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Luchadoras es el grupo formado por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que siempre se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias. Desean poder crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal, para ser mejores personas y seres humanos.
Maria del Carmen es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la costura, con lo que ha podido ayudar a su familia y de esa forma cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen. Una de sus metas es poder agrandar su taller y de esa forma podre ayudar a más personas en su barrio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, botones y demás insumos con los cuales podrá cumplir con la demanda y pedidos de sus clientes. Ellas están muy contentas con el apoyo de la fundación y de kiva.
texts.en:
“Luchadoras” (Battlers) is a group formed by 13 women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. They are very hard-working and struggling people who always put forth maximum effort to be able to help their families. The members want to be able to grow, not only economically, but also personally, in order to become better people and better human beings.

Maria del Carmen is one of the members. She is a seamstress, by which activity she has helped her family and in this manner, covered their expenses which grow from day to day. One of her goals is to be able to expand her shop and, in this way, she can help more people in her barrio.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy cloth, thread, fasteners, buttons, and other supplies necessary to meet demand and fill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: buy cloth, thread, fasteners, buttons and other needed sewing supplies.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Unidas Group

texts.es:
Son integrantes del comité Emprendedoras Unidas, mujeres activas y muy sacrificadas. En total son 15 mujeres  quienes  pretenden mejorar su calidad de trabajo, están motivadas en sus actividades con el deseo de mejorar sus ingresos. Agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada.
La Sra. Gabina  es soltera, ella se dedica a la  venta de remedios refrescantes en el Mercado de la localidad.  Los planes de ella es generar más ganancias, sin duda el deseo suyo es salir adelante trabajando con aspiraciones y deseo de superación por medio del esfuerzo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remedios naturales en cantidad, con lo que podrá abastecerse y tener más en stock, por si tenga pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
These are members of the “Emprendedoras Unidas” (United Women Entrepreneurs) committee.  They are a total of 15 very active and sacrificing women who want to improve the quality of their work lives and are motivated by the desire to increase their incomes.  They appreciate Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunities given to them.

Gabina is single and sells refreshing drinks in the local market.  Her plans are to generate more income.  Without a doubt her goal is to get ahead through her aspirations and to succeed through her effort.

She is asking for this loan to buy natural drinks in quantity, so that she can stock up for when she gets more orders.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Wasty

texts.fr:
Wasty est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un comptable. Elle a trois enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 9 ans.
Wasty travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Wasty a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Wasty voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Wasty is 40 years old and married to an accountant. She has 3 children, aged between 9 and 15, who all to to school. Wasty has been a small retailer since 2006. She sells cereals from her home to all types of customers. She works alone and gets her supplies in Lomé. Right now, her main challenge is her lack of inventory.

Wasty has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Wasty would like to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family's essential needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 62 years old and a widow with 11 children.

Adelina works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Adelina has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Adelina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda, a 53-year-old widow with seven children, resides in Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte: Philippines where she has been operating a family member's general store for two years, earning a monthly income of PHP 2,000.00.

In 2009, Florenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to purchase additional products to sell. In the future, Florenda wants to build a house and supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu lives in Buluk.  She sells food from a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children, who are all still in school. 

Abu heard about BRAC South Sudan from her credit officer.  This is her second loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 400 SDG in order to purchase onions. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions for her food stall.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has an optical shop that she has been running for the past nine years.  She is 42 years old and married to Mwaniki.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy spectacle frames to add to her stock.

In the future, Agnes hopes to become one of the leading opticians in the Nakuru area.

loans.use: To buy spectacle frames for her optical shop.

loans.name: Dorn

texts.en:
Dorn, 33, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area well-known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey, etc.). She and her husband have been involved in growing rice and fattening pigs to sell for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Additionally, she sells rice at the market in order to generate extra income to support the family.

Due to transportation problems, Dorn is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for delivering rice to her clients. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for delivering rice to her clients.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives in Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 36 years old, married and has seven children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by running a business where she sells vegetables to people who live in her community. She earns about 2,500 PHP a month from her work. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional vegetables to sell. In 2009, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living conditions. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is 37 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Elnora is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elnora has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph has operated his tailoring business in Nakuru town for the last four years.  He is 40 years old, married and has one child, who is enrolled in school. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our clients and is applying for his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more cloth to use in making dresses. In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his business and open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for making dresses.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari, 39, is married and works as a boda boda (motorcycle) operator in Voi. He has been in this business for the last two years and is doing great.

This marks his fourth loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business and with it, he plans to purchase another used motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and to open a business for his spouse. He hopes to become successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase another used motorcycle.

loans.name: Sharifatou

texts.fr:
Sharifatou est une femme âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée å un ingénieur. Elle a un enfant de huit  ans qui va à l’école.
Sharifatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend des céréales, du riz, du sucre et de l’huile pour tous clients à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale la rupture de stock.
Sharifatou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales, du riz, du sucre et de l’huile. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Sharifatou voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de diversifier les produits et assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Sharifatou is 28 years old and married to an engineer. She has an 8-year-old child who attends school. Sharifatou has been a small retailer since 2003. She sells cereals, rice, sugar and oil from her home to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Presently, her main challenge is her lack of inventory.

Sharifatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals, rice, sugar and oil. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Sharifatou would like to increase the size of her business. She plans to use her profits to diversify her product range and take care of her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em, 62, is a local farmer who has been living in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia.  She has been engaged in rice husbandry since 1980, and yields an income in the neighborhood of $2.50 per day.  Em has five married children and a single one, who currently lives with her.

In order to upgrade her living, Em wants to start another type of business to sell coffee and tea in her commune.  This will help her family improve its income.  Em would like to take out some funds from HKL and Kiva to start her new business.

loans.use: to open a cafe.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 48 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Mantic, Tangub, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. For the last year, she has earned a living by owning and operating a general store where she sells a variety of different products. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to have additional working capital to use in her business. Marina has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, she wants to build a house and have her children complete their education.

loans.use: have additional working capital for her business.

loans.name: Yân

texts.en:
Yân, 52, has been married for many years but she doesn’t have any children. She permanently lives in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia, where she grows rice to generate her livelihood. Her husband is also in this type of business.

With her first loan from HKL, Yân will purchase a plot of farmland to expand her present business. In the coming seasons, Yân hopes to collect a satisfactory harvest from her rice field.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland to expand her present business.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 34 years old and has been in the butchery business for the past two years. She is married to Joseph and they have three children aged between 11 and five years old

Naomi was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a cow to be slaughtered to add to her stock of meat for sale.

In future, Naomi hopes to become one of the leading butchers in the Nakuru area.

loans.use: to buy a cow to slaughter

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 26-year-old married man. He describes himself to be honest and aggressive. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, bread, salt, cooking oil, eggs, Colgate, etc. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a fast growing area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the retail store.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more stock of wheat flour, sugar, salt, etc. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Bayartsetseg

texts.en:
Bayartsetseg is a 31-year-old married lady who lives with her family in an outer ger district that lacks basic infrastructure in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She works at a local training center and her spouse runs a taxi business. 

Bayartsetseg’s son and daughter attend secondary school and kindergarten. The current house that the family live in is so bad and unsafe, so the parents have decided to make some renovation work for their house.  Also they want to make better and safer living conditions for their children. With this loan, Bayartsetseg plans to purchase some support materials for renovation.

loans.use: to purchase necessary construction materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is single and has three children whose ages range from one to six years old. She describes herself as honest and kind. She operates a school where she is a teacher. Rose has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a busy estate and her main customers are the estate's residents. She says her biggest challenge is late payments from parents. She will use this loan for Kes 20,000 to buy more stationery. Rose's dream and business goal is to run three more school like the one she has now within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more stationery for her school.

loans.name: Nouwagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUWAGNON est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Odette est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour la sixième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Odette n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Odette est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Norbert. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux besoins de sa famille, Odette mène comme activité depuis douze ans, la vente de céréales (maïs, haricot) et parallèlement, la vente de l'huile végétale dans son quartier. Odette achète ses produits dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Odette et les autres membres du groupe NOUWAGNON sollicitent un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Nouwagnon group is composed of 3 people who all live in the same district of Benin. Odette, the group's representative, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. The group is requesting ALIDé's financial support for the 6th time, in order to increase their level of business and be better able to respond to customer demand.

Odette did not go to school. She is 35 years old and married to Norbert. The couple have 5 dependent children who all go to school. The couple both contribute to the family's various expenses. Odette has been selling cereals (corn, beans) and vegetable oil in her district for 12 years, so that she is able to contribute to her family's needs. She gets her supplies in a region of Benin.

Odette and the other members of the Nouwagnon group are requesting a 6th loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen their businesses and better satisfy their customers. Their aim is to increase their level of business.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, beans and cans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony (pictured with her granddaughter) is now a cleaner for a company. Her husband, Voeun, is a mason. They live in a village on the Mekong River about 10 miles north of Phnom Penh and they have five children: one son and four daughters. Two are married and live in separate homes, one is a garment worker and another one attends school. 

Sony is requesting a loan of $400 to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get work

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng is 42 years old and living in Kompong Cham province. She has a life partner with her husband and has been blessed with 4 school-age children attending local schools. Pheng is a rice farmer and her husband works as a policeman in the commune.

The purpose of this loan is to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to replace the old one that often breaks while performing other tasks. She is very happy and appreciates the support from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to replace the old one

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba lives with her husband and six dependents in Krofofordo, near Abura, Ghana.  Araba sells maize, gari (dry-fried grated cassava), groundnuts (a type of peanut) and charcoal.  Beside her are bags of the charcoal that she sells.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She is married to a driver. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family.  Araba needs this loan to purchase bags of maize, groundnuts and charcoal to sell.  With the new profits, Araba wants to become a distributor of charcoal to retailers.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize, groundnuts and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more handbags for resale.

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Emanuel, who is in his late 20s, is married. He has been running a business of selling radios, television sets, and motorcycles. He works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy and sell radios, television sets, and motorcycles.  He has successfully paid back all of his loans. He requests a loan to buy antennas, television cables, and memory cards to sell. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Pamoja," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy antennas, television cables, and memory cards to sell.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is married and has three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She operates a food stall and sells her goods from home. She has worked in this business for the last eight years. Her main customers are neighbors and passersby. Her family's other source of income is her husband's earnings. Her greatest business challenge is her low purchasing power and her biggest monthly expenses are school fees and food. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped-in water. Hadija will use this Kes 30,000 loan to repair her business premises by buying more cement and sheets of iron. Hadija hopes to establish a restaurant business in the future and joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to repair her business premises by buying cement and sheets of iron.

loans.name: Lyrece

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lyrece works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store, entertainment and farming rice. Lyrece is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Lyrece has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 58-year-old livestock seller in Voi, Kenya.  He is a married father of three.  He has been buying and selling livestock for the past thirty years. His business is doing great.

This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD to finance his business.  He plans to purchase more goats, cattle, sheep and poultry.  He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay his loan. 

He hopes to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to re-sell.

loans.name: Inecio

texts.es:
El señor Inecio tiene 64 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, se dedica al servicio de fletes hace mas de 20 años. El señor Inecio es muy responsable y profesional en su trabajo, busca siempre la excelencia en su actividad y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad recibida para compartir con todos su vida profesional.
Su meta es poder trabajar siempre y de esa forma poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa. Comenta que está muy contento con lo que hace, pues este ha sido su medio de subsistencia hace unos años ya.
Solicita el crédito para hacerle mantenimiento a su vehículo, ya que este es imprescindible para su trabajo y para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Inecio is 64 years old and lives in the city of Itá.  He has been working as a truck driver for more than 20 years.  Inecio is very responsible and professional in his work.  He is always seeking excellence in his business and he is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity they are giving him to share his professional life with everybody.

Inecio's goal is to always be able to work so that he can provide his family with what they need to lead a decent and respectable life.  He says that he is very happy with what he does as it has supported him for some years now.

Inecio is requesting this loan to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle as it is essential for his work and for supporting his family.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of accessories needed for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 28, is married to Bernard, who contributes to the family income. She has one child, aged seven. Margaret has been selling shoes and bags for about three years, with an income of around 15,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

This is her second loan from KADET Ltd., after successfully repaying the previous one. Margaret wants to use the loan to buy more shoes and bags for resale. She hopes to give her child a quality education and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en:
Silvester, 56, is a posho mill owner in Kilifi. He is a married father of three. Silvester grinds maize using his posho mill and sells maize flour to his customers. His business has been operating for the past four years with success.

This marks his fourth loan term to finance his business with KADET Ltd. He plans to renovate his business premises and purchase more bags of maize for grinding. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

Silvester hopes to have a more profitable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to renovate his business premises and purchase more bags of maize.

loans.name: Jardin Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDIN” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Aida es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de masitas, venta de culares, venta de electrodomésticos, venta de cosméticos, venta de bisutería, venta de piza, puto viva, repostería, venta de material escolar.

La señora Aida,  indica que es el sexto año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de deportivos que viene trabajando hace años, mismo que aprendió de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de de deportivos) que adquiere de los mayoristas  y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones, el consultorio de salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Sdenka ya que fue presurosa a su fuente laboral.
texts.en:
The "Jardin" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada regional office. It is is made up of eight members, and is led by a board of directors, of which Aida is the chair. 

The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied. They include small businesses selling pastries, cold cuts, home appliances, costume jewelry, pizza, desserts, school supplies, as well as a public telephone service. 

Aida says that this is the sixth year she has been working at Pro Mujer. She joined the institution at a friend's invitation. Currently she has a business selling sportswear, in which she has been working for years, having learned it from her mother. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase her working capital for purchase of the sportswear, which she acquires from the wholesalers and then sells at her stand. This type of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family, as she is in a common-law relationship and has three children. 

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the meetings and the health clinic. Aida is not shown in the photo, as she needed to get back to her place of work quickly.

loans.use: To buy sportswear.

loans.name: Rosuet

texts.en:
Rosuet, 43, is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of spices to sell.

Rosuet has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the spice business for 10 years and also earns an income from a general store and from farming rice.

Rosuet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina  “Santa Clara” están en el  Décimo Segundo  con  20 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas y realizan labores de trabajos en equipos, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan Actividades para la recaudación de fondos para el grupo como Polladas y Sorteos.
Fátima es una de las integrantes, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Se dedica a esto hace ya un tiempo y gracias a eso ha podido formarse una buena clientela, lo cual le ha ayudado a salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, con lo cual podrá cumplir con pedidos que tiene, ya que ha recibido muchos. Todas estas mujeres están muy contentas con la ayuda de la fundación, pues eso les ha ayudado a mantener a sus familias e hijos.
texts.en:
This committee is called 'Santa Clara' and its 20 members are in their 12th loan cycle.  This is a group whose members stand out in their neighborhood as being very united, supportive and responsible.  They work as a team and they all have a great entrepreneurial spirit.  They carry out different activities to raise funds for the group such as 'polladas' (a social event often used as a way of raising funds where people come together to dance and eat - mainly  chicken) and raffles.  

Fátima is one of the members of this group.  She is a very hard-working and tenacious woman whose business is selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for some time and has been able to form a good customer base.  This has enabled her to do well and help her family.

Fátima is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics so that she can fill some of the many orders that she has.  All of the women are very happy to receive Fundación Paraguaya's help as it enables them to support their families and children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Agneta

texts.en: Agneta is a 62-year-old married woman.  She has four children between 20 and 35 years old.  She describes herself as determined and God-fearing.  She operates a school, where she also teaches.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  Her school is located on a busy estate and her primary students are the estate's residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the delay of payments from parents.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more stationery.  Her business goal is to run several schools in various locations within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery for her school.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, 63, is single with three children and resides in Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. She started a business venture running a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. Each month, Irene earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this type of business. 

Irene has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Irene wants to build a house and to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is 59 years old and the father of four children.  He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  Nestor used his last loan to purchase daily use commodities to sell.  His business has grow and become successful.  Now, he is taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand his product offering. He hopes to be able to grow his business more.

loans.use: to purchase more items for his store.

loans.name: Abdurabi

texts.ru: Абдураби проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он имеет высшее образование. Уже 7 лет он работает бухгалтером. Кроме того у него имеется пункт заправки природного газа. В этой области Абдураби более семи лет. Он берет кредит для заправки газовых баллонов.
texts.en: Abdurabi lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 37 years old, married and has two children.  He has a higher education.  Abdurabi has been working as an accountant for seven years.  Besides this, he has a natural gas filling station.  Abdurabi has been in this business for over seven years.  He is requesting this loan to refill gas tanks.

loans.use: to refill gas tanks

loans.name: Sasun

texts.ru:
Сасун родился в 1983 году в городе Капане, где он окончил Капанскую среднюю школу. После он поступил в Ереванский политехнический институт, в котором получил специальность инженера-механика. 
Сасун женат и у него есть сын, которому годик. В данный момент жена не работает, так как находится в декретном отпуске. 
В 2007 года Сасун организовал собственный бизнес. Он арендует помещение в Капане, где он продает женскую, мужскую и детскую одежду. Благодаря своему бизнесу Сасун приобрел автомобиль, с помощью которого он привозит товары для своего бизнеса из Еревана. За товаром Сасун ездит раз в месяц. С помощью дохода, получаемого от бизнеса Сасун содержит свою семью. Ему необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм, для приобретения весеннего ассортимента одежды для своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Sasun was born in 1983 in the city of Kapan, where he graduated from the Kapan secondary school.  He was then accepted to the Yerevan Polytechnic Institute and subsequently obtained a specialty of a mechanical engineer.  Sasun is married and has a son, who is one years old.  Currently, his wife does not work because she is on a maternity leave.  Sasun started his business in 2007.  He leases a space in Kapan, where he sells women's, men's and children's clothing.    Thanks to his business, Sasun purchased a car, which he now uses to transport merchandise for his business from Yerevan.  Sasun travels for merchandise once per month.  The business income helps him to provide for his family.  Sasun needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram to purchase a spring selection of clothing for his business.

loans.use: to buy a spring selection of clothing for his business

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Dona Evangelina tiene 65 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 42 y 26 años de edad con los cuales vive en la aldea la Esperanza, Tela, Atlántida.
Posee desde hace 15 años un negocio de venta de ropa donde vende (ropa interior, calsetas, toallas, manteles de cocina y telas para cortinas). Inicio esta actividad con capital que le proporciono su hermana.
