Her husband works as a driver for hire. For the past five years, Nhung has run a general store to cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy beverages and a greater quantity of basic products such as snack foods to stock her general store.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy beverages and a greater quantity of basic products such as snack foods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is forty-two years old, married and has four children.

Sattar has owned a market since 2009, selling foodstuffs and household items. He has a sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to fix the wall of his market, purchase large fridge and buy more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits so that he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: in order to fix the wall of his market, purchase a large fridge and have more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Philomina Maame

texts.en:
Philomina Maame sells maize, groundnuts, cloth and cosmetics in Krofofrodo near Abura. She is married to a driver and has one child. She uses her income to support her husband and for the general up-keep of their home. 

Philomina needs this loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With the profit, Philomina wishes to acquire a large quantity of maize to distribute to the retail shops.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Tabitha Wamaitha

texts.en:
Tabitha still runs a mali mali shop, a business she started four years ago. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to purchase buckets, basins, jugs, and plates. 

The profit earned will be ploughed back into her business. Her dream is to see herself prosper in her business, as well as see her children educated at higher levels.

loans.use: To purchase items for her trading business (e.g basins, plastic buckets, jugs, etc.)

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane, 44, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Mary Jane operates a rug making business. Her products are small rugs and larger doormats. She makes round rugs out of excess textile cloth she bought from a factory. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding down the highway in a speeding jeep. Mary Jane directly sells her products to her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Mary Jane is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mary Jane hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is a fifty-seven-year-old woman with two children, one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling noodles to people in her community. 

She started this business twenty years ago to cover her family's daily living expenses. Her business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy furniture, appliances and good quality ingredients to make better food to attract more customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy furniture, appliances, and good quality ingredients.

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is thirty-seven years old, married and has three children.

Akil has owned a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, dairy products and household items. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market. He aims to make more profit, so that he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent for his market.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a forty-three-year-old divorced woman. She has four children whose ages range from twelve to twenty-two. She describes herself as a diligent and focused woman. 

She operates a retail stall where she sells charcoal and food. She has been involved in this business for eight years and employs four staff members. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Lucy's business goal is to run a bigger charcoal-selling stall within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is a married woman. She has four children who are all enrolled in school. Faiza operates a charcoal selling business and sells her goods from home. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbours. Faiza's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Faiza will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase thirty bags of charcoal. Faiza aspires to supply charcoal wholesale in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase thirty bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Diborah

texts.en:
Diborah is a thirty-two year old married woman. She has two children who are one and five years old. She describes herself as welcoming and social. 

She operates a tailor shop where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge as stiff competition. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a sewing machine. Her business goal is to run a big embroidery shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build her own house.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a petty trader at Krofofordo near Abura. Some of the items she trades in are salted fish, maize, tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt and other food items. Ekua has been into this business for forty years now. She is a widow and has four children. She uses her income to pay her accommodation and utility bills. Ekua need this loan to purchase more salted fish, maize, tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt and other food items to sell. With the new profit Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more salted fish, maize, tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt and other food items to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is twenty-five years old, single, and with no dependents. He sells second hand clothes, a business he started seven years ago and gets a good income. He wants to purchase shoes and trousers to sell and has requested a loan worth KES 30,000. 

The profit he makes from his businesses will help him repay the loan and expand his business. His dream is to own a business empire and his own home. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Babatoundé Jacques G.

texts.fr: Jacques est marié et à 3 enfants. Il est âgé de 38ans.Il commercialise des produits de la SOBEBRA. Sentant le besoin de mieux satisfaire ses clients vue la demande, il s'est rapproché de Finadev pour un concours afin de mieux s'approvisionner et de diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
Jacques is married with three children. He is 38 years old. He is a retailer of Sobebra products.

Wanting to better respond to his customers' requests, he approached Finadev to obtain a loan so he can improve his supplies and diversify his product offerings.

loans.use: Buy 15 cases of soft drinks and 20 cases of beer

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee, a residence of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, is married. She is taking care of her school-aged child.

Imee used her previous loan to buy additional grocery items to sell. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase more drinks to sell. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase drinks to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a forty-seven-year-old married woman. She has two children aged twenty-nine and thirty. She describes herself as social. Previously, she was involved in a tailoring activity. She operates a general store where she sells material, trousers, earrings etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located near a city council market and her primary customers are walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge as being the high prices of materials. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy material, table cloths, and shoes. Margaret's business goal is to run similar several general stores within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material, table cloths and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden lives in Yei. She sells clothes, and has been in business for a year. She is thirty-five years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Kiden heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a single woman. She has one child who is enrolled in school. Mejumaa operates a shoe and clothes selling business and sells her goods from door to door. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbours. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mejumaa will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of shoes and clothes for resale. Mejumaa aspires to establish a wholesale shop selling shoes and clothes in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is thirty years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is forty-two years old, married and has five children, who two of whom work.

Ghaleb is a farmer; he has owned a buffalo farm since 1985. He sells many types of dairy products. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and he is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to make aluminum fences and to purchase dry feed. He is aiming to make more profit so he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to make aluminum fences and to purchase dry feed.

loans.name: Lucina Tacubaya Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Lucina Tacubaya  esta conformado por  cuatro personas trabajadoras, alegres y humildes con deseos de superarse y mejorar sus negocios para brindarle  beneficios a su comunidad  ya que desean crecer  como comerciantes.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Lucina una señora de sesenta y nueve años de edad , ella nos cuenta que se caracteriza como una señora trabajadora y humilde que desea mejorar su  tienda de abarrotes para que sus paisanos encuentren lo que necesiten  y no tenga que viajar para comprar su despensa de la semana ya que ella les da fiado a las personas ya que en ocasiones no traen dinero suficiente y ella les da el productos y después se los pasan a pagar.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas  mercancía de abarrotes para la venta como es
galletas,refrescos,mayonesa,chiles,cebolla.frijol,arroz,aceite,manteca,sopas,jabon,detergente  en  polvo, suavitel  ,pan,leche,café,azucar ,quesos y huevos.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
María-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Jaime-quien se dedica a la venta de herramientas mecánicas.
Briseida-quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
 Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudar a las personas de pueblos padres  para que puedan  crecer como comerciantes.
texts.en:
This group is called Lucina Tacubaya. It consists of four people who are hard-working, happy, and humble, and want to aim ever higher and improve their businesses to offer benefits to their community, since they want to grow as retailers.

One of the members of the group is Señora Lucina, a woman who is 69 years old. She tells us that she is known as a hard-working and humble woman who wants to improve her grocery store so that her fellow citizens can find what they need and don't have to travel to do their weekly shopping. Furthermore, she gives credit to people since they sometimes don't bring enough money, and she gives them the products and later they come by to pay her.

She is applying for the loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as crackers, soft drinks, mayonnaise, chilies. onions, beans, rice, oil, lard, soups, soap, powdered detergent, Suavitel (fabric softener), bread, milk, coffee, sugar, cheeses, and eggs.

The other members of the group are: Maria, who sells groceries; Jaime, who sells mechanical tools, and Briseida, who sells bread.  They give thanks to the foundation for helping the people of impoverished towns so that they can grow as businesspeople.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa est une femme âgé(e) de 27 ans. Elle est mariée å un  transitaire. Elle a 03 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 05 ans et le dernier a 01 an.  
Yawa travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2010. Elle vend à ses clients  dans une boutique . Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le marché. 
Yawa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité afin de permettre son développement. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yawa voudrait ouvrir d’autres boutiques dans d’autres coins de la ville et même en dehors de Lomé.  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’avoir une famille.
texts.en:
Yawa is a 27-year old woman. Her husband  works in logistics. She has three children, two of whom are in school. The eldest is five years old, and the youngest one year old.

Yawa has been reselling staple foods since 2010. She sells out of a store. She stocks up in Lomé. At present, her greatest challenge is market competition. Yawa has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy groceries. She would like to reinvest in her business in order to stimulate its growth. In the years to come, Yawa would like to open other stores in other areas of the city and even outside of Lomé. She says that with the profits, she plans to [support] her family.

loans.use: to buy staple foods

loans.name: Aideth

texts.es: Aideth vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 y 16 años, al sur de la ciudad, donde se dedica a dos negocios, por unlado a la venta de mercancías  variadas, mediante pedidos que hacen sus clientes y por otro lado vende frituras y refrescos.  Su negocio principal de venta de mercancia lo inició hace mas de 15 años,  con un capital de trabajo pequeño,  vendiendo ropa, calzado, especialmente. Posteriormente recibió crédito en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en el programa de grupo solidario y con ello ha mejorado su nivel de ingresos y creó su nuevo negocio. Con esta organización tiene 18 años de estar vinculada y ha accedido a 21 créditos, que ha invertido efectivamente en su negocio y ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su nivel de ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará productos fritos y refrescos y tambien calzado escolar útiles y uniformes porque sus clientes usuales así lo requieren, debido a que están en la época en la cual los estudiantes ingresan a clases. Aideth se siente muy satisfecha con su negocio y el apoyo recibido por la Fundación, porque ha logrado hasta adquirir su propia vivienda.  Su meta y gran desafío es tener un almacén de ropa en la calle principal, con local propio y por eso trabaja diariamente sin descanso para más adelante lograrlo.
texts.en: Aideth lives with her husband and two children who are 12 and 16 years old.  They live in the south of the city which is where she has her two businesses.  One of her businesses is selling a variety of merchandise to fill orders made by her customers and the other is selling fried food and soft drinks.  She started her main business selling general merchandise more than 15 years ago, with a small amount of working capital, mainly selling clothing and footwear.  She then received a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as a member of a community bank.  She used the loan to improve her income and start her new business.  Aideth has been working with this organization for 18 years and she has received 21 loans which she has invested wisely in her businesses. She has managed to increase her working capital and also her income.  Aideth is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy fried products and soft drinks.  She will also buy school supplies, footwear and uniforms because her regular customers need them as students are starting their classes right now.  Aideth feels very satisfied with her business and the support she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because, as a result, she has managed to acquire her own home.  Her goal and greatest challenge is to own her own clothes store in the main street.  She will work every day without rest in order to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to buy fried products and soft drinks, and also school supplies, footwear and uniforms

loans.name: José Arturo

texts.es: José Arturo de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su familia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y loroco además del maicillo y el jocote, ya tiene mucha clientela pues todo lo que produce es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es único José es muy amable con todos sus clientes; es un hombre enérgico siempre dispuesto a aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que el más grande secreto para el triunfo es el amor y la dedicación a su labor, quiere ver crecer su negocio y como ha aumentado la demanda quiere satisfacer las necesidades de las personas que lo visitan, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima por mayor maíz, loroco, maicillo etc. José Arturo tiene fe que así podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
José Arturo is 55 and lives with his family. He grows corn and loroco (an edible flower used as flavoring), in addition to sorghum and cauliflower. He already has many customers, as everything he produces is very good quality and really affordable. 

In addition, the service is extraordinary, as José is very friendly with all his customers. He is an energetic man, always ready to take advantage of all the opportunities that arise. He believes that the greatest secret for success is love and devotion to one's work. 

He wants to see his business grow, and as demand has increased, he wants to meet the needs of the people who visit him. That is why he decided to apply to Integral for a loan that allows him to buy supplies at wholesale for growing corn, loroco, sorghum, etc. 

José Arturo has faith that in this way, he will be able to give his family a full life.

loans.use: To buy supplies at wholesale for growing corn, loroco and sorghum

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La señora Emma actualmente vive por la zona del barrio oriental,  nuestra clienta se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de comidas (almuerzo),  se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 20 años trabajando mucho ya que tiene que levantarse a tempranas horas de la mañana para la preparación de sus alimento su negocio se encuentra ubicado en casa propia,  La clienta tiene excelente historial de pago ya que no tuvo ningún problema en el pago de sus cuotas en esta ocasión la Sra. Emma solicita el  crédito para  la compra de un Frízer para conservar sus verduras y refrescos fríos,  se encuentra feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que se le estan brindando, y agradeció por la rapidez con la que se atendió y por el apoyo que le brindan para mejorar y crecer en su negocio y así de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Emma currently lives in the Barrio Oriental area. She has been preparing and selling food (lunch) for more than 20 years. She works hard, getting up early in the morning to prepare her food. Her business is located in her own home.

Emma has an excellent credit history and has had no problem making her loan payments promptly. At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase a freezer to store her vegetables and cold drinks. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity being provided her and especially for how quickly she has been helped and for the support that will enable her to improve and expand her business. In this way she will increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old. She is married and they have five children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past seven years.

She was brought to KADET LTD by a field officer. This is her second loan. She paid the previous loan well. She will use the amount to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a widowed woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be diligent and focused.

She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair dressing services and sells braids, blankets, chemicals, hair oil, and bed sheets. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located at a shopping center and her primary customers are ladies.

Eunice plans to run a beauty shop and will be using the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy beauty products. Her business goal is to run another beauty salon within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for a new beauty shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for one year. She is 32 year old, married, and has three children and all of them are still in school. 

Cicilia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG.500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Carmen Marcelina

texts.es:
Carmen es un mujer de 44 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de CD.
Su historia empezó desde hace 1 año trabajaba para una señora preparando bocaditos y decidió independizarse, su trabajo lo hace con una hija y el horario es de 5:00 hasta las 11:00, no tiene dificultades, no está soltera, si tiene 3 hijos todos son mayores de edad. Su sueño más importante es seguir trabajando para sus hijos y seguir construyendo su casa. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para comprar Cd y bebidas y asi tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 44 year old woman with many aspirations to succeed in selling CDs in the coming years.  Her story began a year ago when she was working for a lady preparing snacks and decided to become independent. She does her current work with her daughter and her schedule is from 5 to 11. She has no problems. She is not single and has three children, who are all adults.

Carmen’s principle dream is to continue working on behalf of her children and to continue building her house. Consequently she would like a loan to purchase CDs and drinks so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy CDs and drinks

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself to be principled man. 

Samuel operates a retail store where he sells bread. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located at a shopping centre and his primary customers are walk-ins. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of bread. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more crates of bread. Samuel's business goal is to run a bigger shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy crates of bread.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun is from Ang Snoul district. She is 47 years old and a good mother of six children. Recently, her oldest child got married and now lives separately with an independent life. Chhun is operating a pig-fattening business, from which she yields approximately $4.00 per day.

Chhun now is taking out her first loan to invest in her pig-raising business. She will use it to buy feeds and vitamin for her pigs. She is very happy and hopes to get this loan from our kind lenders to further develop her present project.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemary Ekua

texts.en:
Rosemary Ekua is divorced and has four children. Rosemary is a small-scale trader. She trades in accessories such as cosmetics, jewelry, hairbands and other items at Krofofrodo near Abura. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children and to pay their school fees. 

Rosemary needs this loan to purchase more jewelry and cosmetics for resale. With the new profit, she wishes to mount a better shop for the sale of her accessories.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 37 años, es una mujer buena, amable y emprendedora, esta casada con Jorge de 45 años con quien tiene tres hijos, Abigail de 13, Katerine de 12 y la menor Miluska de 6, ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, vive en una casa propia. Todos los días desde muy temprano, Marleni sale al mercado en busca de los pescados más frescos y de mejor calidad, esto hace debido a que su trabajo consiste en la venta de cebiche. Coloca sus materiales en la vereda de su casa que es en donde realiza su trabajo. Es una cocinera experta y con una manos bendecidas para poder lograr la mejor sazón de este plato. Antes tenía un puesto en un mercado que esta muy cerca de su casa, pero con el tiempo cayó enferma y tuvo que ver la manera de seguir trabajando pero sin tener que alejarse mucho de su hogar, es por eso que hace tres meses decidió realizar su trabajo en su casa. Trabaja sola ya que aprendió a tener un ritmo de trabajo muy rápido. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede estar en contacto con los clientes y poder conversar con ellos, le encanta entablar conversación y mientras hace su trabajo se divierte y conoce nuevas ideas y maneras diferentes de pensar, tiene muchos planes a futuro, pero lo que mas le gustaría es poder mejor y volver a poner su puesto en el mercado ya que ahí le genera mas ingresos y mejores ganancias. Este será el quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes con personas responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para continuar preparando sus deliciosos platos de comida, además de renovar algunos utensilios y platos.
texts.en:
Marleni, 37, is a good, friendly and enterprising woman. She is married to Jorge, 45, with whom she has three children, Abigail, 13, Katerine, 12, and the youngest, Miluska, 6. She works hard to provide them with a better quality of life. She lives in her own house.

Every day Marleni gets up early to go to the market in search of the freshest and highest quality fish. She does so because her work consisting of selling ceviche (marinated fish cocktail). She puts her materials on the sidewalk in front of her house where she does her business.  She is an expert cook and has hands blessed with the ability to concoct the best sauce for this dish.

Previously she had a stall in a market very near her house, but over time she became ill and had to find a way to continue working but without having to be away from home so much. She works alone, since she learned to develop a very fast work rhythm. She enjoys her work a great deal because she is able to have contact with customers and can talk with them. She loves starting conversations and while she works she has fun learning new ideas and different ways of thinking.

Marleni has many plans for the future but what she would most like is to be able to get better and return to set up her stall in the market for she generates more income there and has better profits. This will be her fifth loan with MFP and she is pleased to know that she will have financial support because she will be more assured of advancing in her work. She promises to make her payments on time as she has on her previous loans.
 
As well, she is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people. With the 1,500 nuevos soles requested she will purchase ingredients and supplies to continue preparing her delicious food and also replace some utensils and plates.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fish and replace her utensils.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ей 31 год. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Она имеет среднее образование. Более десяти лет она занимается шитьем. Кредит берет для приобретения компьютерной швейной машинки.
texts.en: Nazira lives in the town of Istaravshan. She is 31 years old. She is married, with one child. She has received secondary education. She has been working as a seamstress for over 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy a  computerized sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a  computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Concepción tiene 60 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad entre 28 a 45 años, ella vive con su esposo en la col. Victoria de Choloma cortes.
Doña  Concepción hace 5 años que genera sus propios ingresos, pues los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes, y  ha decidido elaborar tamalitos de elote y montucas de elote con carne, para vender. Se levanta muy de mañana a preparar estos productos. Además de vender los tamalitos y montucas vende también el elote cocinado. Anteriormente vendía tortillas de maíz pero miro que los productos de elote son más rentables y decidió hacerlo.
Este préstamo es el primero que solicita a ODEF y lo va invertir en los insumos necesarios para elaborar tamalitos y montucas, como elote, manteca, azúcar, canela, carne, especies, etc.
Ella espera obtener más ingresos para superarse y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción is 60 years old and married.  She has six grown children between the ages of 28 and 45.  She lives with her husband in the Victoria neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes.

Concepción has been generating her own income for five years.  Her husband’s income was insufficient, and she decided to make corn cakes and corn tamales stuffed with pork to sell.  She gets up very early in the morning to prepare these products.  In addition to selling the corn cakes and corn tamales, she sells grilled corn on the cob.  She previously sold corn tortillas, but she saw how the corn cakes and corn tamales were more profitable, so she decided to make and sell them.

This is the first loan that she has requested from ODEF.  She will use it to buy the ingredients she needs to make the corn cakes and corn tamales.  She will buy things like corn on the cob, lard, sugar, cinnamon, meat, and spices, etc.

She hopes to get more income in order to improve herself and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make corn cakes and corn tamales with meat.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Zully, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad. Ella forma parte del grupo "Fortaleza" formado por 7 socias residentes del distrito de Carabayllo.
La Sra. Zully, se dedica al servicio de confecciones, desde hace 30 años, ésta ha sido su fuente de ingreso, con lo cual ella pudo apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de materiales, para tener un stock listo para atender a su clientela.
texts.en:
Ms. Zully is 56 years old, married, and has three adult children.  She’s a member of the “Fortaleza” (Strength) group, made up of seven residents of Carabayllo.

Ms. Zully makes clothing and has done so for the past 30 years.  This has been the source of income with which she has helped her husband with the family expenses.

She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies so that she will have them in stock to serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes making supplies.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariamu is a widowed woman. She has eight children, three of which are enrolled in school. 

Mariamu operates an open air food business and sells her goods at the market. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Mariamu's other source of income includes husband earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be low purchasing power and her highest monthly expense is food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mariamu will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour and rice. Mariamu aspires to establish a restaurant business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
This is Rona, 27, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, her business partner, and has one child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while also operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Rona operates a buy to sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sell that merchandise for a small profit. Her products are men and women’s clothing and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy from her due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Aside from this, she sells cell phone loads for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rona hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of clothing and merchandise needed for her business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a single parent and has two children. She sells maize and gari (a flour made from cassava roots) at Krofofrodo near Abura. Pictured in front of Ekua is the maize she sells. She has been selling maize and gari for 10 years now.

As a single parent, Ekua uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay the school fees of her children. Ekua need this loan to purchase bags of maize and gari to sell. With the new profit, Ekua wants to acquire large quantities of maize to distribute to retailers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and gari for sale.

loans.name: Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTA” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Berna. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, confección de mantas de vicuña, comerciante de chalona, macramé, venta de chamarras, electricista, tienda de comida, venta de tucumanas.

La señora Berna,  indica que hace más de diez años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de su hija. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de mantas de vicuña que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su consuegra.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de hilo de vicuña) que adquirirá de las ferias  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá a crédito. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The 'KANTUTA' community bank are about to start their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office.  This group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is headed by Berna.  The businesses that the members are engaged in are varied and include: vegetable sales, making blankets from vicuña wool, selling 'chalona' (dried, salted lamb), macrame, selling jackets, working as an electrician, running a food stall and selling 'tucumanas' (meat pastries).

Berna tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for more than ten years.  She joined the institution through an invitation from her daughter.  She currently has a business making vicuña blankets which she has been working in for years.  She learned this business from her daughter's mother-in-law.

Berna is currently requesting a loan to increase her capital (buying vicuña wool which she will acquire in local markets).  After making her products, she will sell them on credit.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  Berna is married and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Berna replied that she likes everything.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 42, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married with three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Erlinda operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food on one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda's dream is to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be principled woman. She operates a general store where she sells items such as plates, spoons, table mats, cups, basins, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs three staff members. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of utensils. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more stock of utensils. Judy's business goal is to run a supermarket within five years.

loans.use: to buy more utensils.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Ven, age 37, is a humble resident who has been residing in Prey Chor. She has a common-law relationship with her husband, who is operating the same business as rice cultivator, and is blessed with four children: three are single and one is already married. To help the family have a good condition, one of Ven’s daughters shares her income by working for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city.

Ven doesn’t want to keep her valued time passing without any result. She plans to use it making an effort to earn a good income and provide a comfortable living to her children. Consequently, Ven would like to acquire some funds from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to rent a plantation, on which she will grow potato crops in the coming season. Through using this loan, Ven will be able to further develop her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for a plantation fee.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is married to a businessman and has two children. Comfort sells jewelry and cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough) and smoked tilapia to sell. She has been into this business for three years now. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation bills. Comfort will uses the loan to purchase more jewelry to sell and bags of maize and tilapia to cook to sell. With the new profit, she will expand to establish a canteen service and also expand her jewelry business.

loans.use: purchase more jewelry to sell and bags of maize and tilapia to cook and sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old and single. She has six children. She operates a mobile boutique and has been in the business for the past seven years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

She was introduced to KADET LTD, by a KADET customer. This is her first term loan and she will use the loan amount to purchase stock of clothes for her business.

Her hope is to own a permanent premises where she can do her business.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Monsieur Salif est un commerçant qui a une bonne connaissance de son domaine d’activité de part le nombre d’année d’expérience : 12 ans. Il démarre sa journée à six heure du matin et l'a fini à 00h. Salif est né en 1970, marié et père de famille. Il vend des denrées alimentaires : oignons, détergeant, des bonbons, et divers  autres marchandises.
Salif demande un crédit de 200000F CFA  pour acheter  les denrées les plus rapides à écouler  comme le sucre, l’oignon, les bouillons, le thé ...
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille.  Avec les bénéfices de son activité, Salif a pour projet futur de construire sa maison.
texts.en: Salif is a salesman who has a good knowledge of his business owing to his 12 years of experience.  He starts his work day at 6 in the morning and finishes at midnight.  Salif was born in 1970.  He is married and has children.  He sells food products, onions, detergents, candies and other merchandise.  Salif has requested a loan for 200,000 CFA with which to buy the food products that sell the quickest such as sugar, onions, stock cubes and tea.  He takes care of his family's daily expenses.  He plans to use the profits from his business to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy food products and other merchandise to re-sell

loans.name: Sanoussi

texts.fr:
Sanoussi est un homme âgé de 58ans. Il est célibataire avec 03 enfants.  
Sanoussi travaille comme revendeur des articles de mercerie depuis 1985. Il vend dans une boutique et achète ses produits à Lomé.
Sanoussi a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 05 rouleaux de popeline, 01 carton de fil à coudre, des douzaines de laine et 144 sachets d’huile à machine.
texts.en:
Sanoussi is a 58-year-old man. He is single with three children.

Sanoussi has been working as a retailer of dry goods since 1985. He sells from a shop and buys his merchandise in Lomé.

Sanoussi has requested his fourth loan from WAGES in order to purchase five bolts of poplin, a box of sewing thread, several lots of wool and 144 packets of machine oil.

loans.use: To purchase dry goods.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 40 year old lady from Migori. She is married to John who is a teacher. They have five children aged between two and 16 years.

Margaret has a charcoal selling business, which she has been operating for the last 42 years. Margaret makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. She is now taking a fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. 

She will use profits to pay back the loan and also provide for her family. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ludovina

texts.es:
Ludovina, de 40 años, es una mujer que siempre le hizo frente a las adversidades de la vida, es madre de Joselin de 6 años a quien cría sola, pues se separó de su pareja y ahora tiene que afrontar la educación y crianza de su menor hija ella sola. Vive a su lado en un cuarto alquilado. Ludovina tiene como trabajo el de la venta de productos regionales, entre las cosas que ofrece tiene carbón, frutas como papaya, cocona, limones, naranjas y otros productos, ella en todo lo que ve negocio invierte pues en su forma de trabajo sabe que si le pone mucho empeño le saldrán las cosas bien. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 12 años y a diario se dirige a una mercado muy concurrido en onde tiene un puesto que todos los días limpia y ordena para así esperar a sus clientes y ofrecerles los mejores productos de la región.
Siempre atiende con una sonrrisa muy grande en su rostro, pues durante el tiempo que tiene su negocio aprendió que el cliente siempre tiene la razón, le está yendo muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes y así puede tener buenos ingresos, siempre tiene algún nuevo proyecto en mente o un nuevo negocio en el cual incursionar y es por eso que tiene planes muy grandes a futuro, por el memento solo desea trabajar mucho para poder juntar capital suficiente y así ampliar su negocio. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará mas productos para su negocio, desea abastecerse de productos regionales ya que por la temporada tendrá que comprar a precio muy elevado mas adelante.
texts.en:
Ludovina, 40, is a woman who always faced up to the adversities of life.  She is the mother of Joselin, 6, whom she raises alone because she separated from her partner and now she has to face educating and raising her minor daughter by herself.  She lives with her in a rented room.  Ludovina has a job selling regional products.  Among the things she offers she has charcoal, fruits such as papaya, cocona, limes, and oranges, and other products.  She invests business in everything she sees because in her line of work she knows that, if she gives it a lot of effort, things will turn out well.

She has been doing her job for 12 years, and every day she goes to a very crowded market where she has a stall that she cleans and organizes to wait for her customers and offer them the best products in the region.  She always serves with a huge smile on her face because, in the time she has had her business, she learned that the customer is always right.  It is going very well for her because she has a lot of customers and so she can have good income.  She always has some new project in mind or a new business to get into, and this is why she has very big plans for the future.  For the moment she only wants to work a lot to be able to raise sufficient capital to expand her business.

This will be her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know she will have some financial help because in this way she will feel much more secure about making progress in her job.  She also promises once again to make her payments on time, as in the previous loans she had.  She also is very happy to belong to her communal bank because everybody is very responsible and supportive.

With the requested amount of 1500 PEN she will buy more products for her business.  She wants to stock up on regional products because later she will have to buy at a higher price because of the season.

loans.use: to buy papaya, cocona fruit, and citrus fruits.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi has practiced farming in Ol’Kalou town for the last four years. She is 58 years old and a widow. She has two children.

Naomi was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan well. She plans to use the loan amount to pay for water installation in her farm and to purchase potato seedlings.

In future, Naomi hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ol’Kalou area.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Maritza Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Leónidas Proaño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maritza, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  6 y de 2 años y medio, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es ebanista.

Ella para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, le realizan muchos pedidos sus clientes ya que trae mercadería de muy buena calidad y en modelos novedosos. Trabaja de tres a cuatro días de la semana y en momentos cuando esta más desocupada,  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería sobretodo de temporada, bermudas, trajes de baño, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  5 años, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
OMPRA 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Leónidas Proaño' community bank meet in the neighborhood of the same name in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round.  It is also known as a city with a beauty which is second to none.  It has a lot of tourist attractions.

Here we meet 23-year-old Maritza who is married and has two children who are 6 and 2 years old.  Her eldest is in school and her husband is a cabinetmaker.

In order to help her husband with their household expenses, Maritza sells all types of clothing.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from her home where some of her customers come to buy.  Her customers make a lot of orders as she provides very good-quality merchandise and offers new designs.  She works three to four days a week and whenever she has free time.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She has been in this business for five years and it is doing very well.

Maritza will use this loan to buy more merchandise (especially seasonal merchandise).  She will buy Bermuda shorts, swimsuits, t-shirts and children's clothing.  She has been a member of her community bank for 5 years.  She is in charge of monitoring payments and she likes it because she used her first loan to start her business.

Maritza's dream is to own her own home because she currently rents.

loans.use: to buy Bermuda shorts, t-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 51 years old and married with three children. She does dairy farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for 20 years and has employed three people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 12,000 KES to buy a solar lamp and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp and animal feed

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, la señora María  del Carmen,  tiene 5 años de tener su tienda de ropa y perfumes  el  cual consiste en una línea de productos que ella pone a la venta siendo su esposo el que le ayuda en su distribución. Sus puntos de venta los tiene en Diriomo, Masaya y Malacatoya.
 
Por esta temporada ella tiene más demanda por lo que se acerca a Ceprodel  para obtener un crédito para la compra de mochilas, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, sombría, perfumería, calcetas para poder satisfacer a sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas y tener una mayor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
In Masaya department, María del Carmen has been running her clothes and perfume business for five years.  She sells a line of products and her husband helps her distribute them.  She makes her sales in Diriomo, Masaya and Malacatoya.

María del Carmen has more demand this season so she approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan with which to buy backpacks, pants, shirts, t-shirts, perfume and socks in order to satisfy her customers, improve her sales and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy backpacks, pants, shirts, t-shirts, perfume and socks

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 44 year old married man. He has five children - three sons and two daughters - with ages ranging from 2 years to 25 years. He describes himself to be social and talkative man. 

He operates a restaurant where he sells food, tea, and snacks. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located near a busy road and his primary customers are walk-ins. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the restaurant. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase wheat flour and cooking fat and to pay his children's school fees. 

Paul's business goal is to expand his restaurant to a hotel and improve his services within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking fat and to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of products needed in her business.

loans.name: Zoumba Group

texts.fr:
Mme Foudailatou est la représentante du groupe ZOUMBA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 21mois. Les 03 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des habits (pagnes) depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter 1 balle et demi de pagnes.

Mme avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et épargner. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de pagne et aider à la construction de leur maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Foudailatou is the representative of the Zoumba Group. She is married and the mother of four children. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest is 21 months old. Three attend school and she has five people under her care.

She has been selling outfits (pagnes [traditional African fabric]) for three years. Mrs. Foudailatou gets her supplies from the market in neighborhood 10. Her customers are men and women.

Mrs. Foudailatou wants to purchase one and a half bales of pagne fabric.

With her savings, Mrs. Foudailatou wants to contribute to her children's school fees and to save money. She aspires to open a large pagnge store and to help with the building of their house.

loans.use: To purchase one and a half bales of pagne [traditional African fabric].

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es: María de Jesús de veintiocho años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee una panadería donde vende variedad de pan dulce y salado, es muy conocida en la localidad pues comercia el pan más exquisito, hecho con materiales de primera calidad a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es excelente; María es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre se encuentra activa a la hora de realizar su labor, está dispuesta a cumplir todas sus metas y su más grande secreto es la constancia y la alegría solo así podrá llegar al éxito, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, azúcar, miel, bandejas etc. María de Jesús tiene la esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María de Jesús, age 25, lives with her children in her own home. She has a bakery where she sells a variety of bread and cake. She is well-known in the area because she sells the most delicious bread, made with top quality ingredients, and her prices are quite accessible. On top of that, her service is excellent. Maria is a very hard-working woman who is always ready to go to work. She is ready to fulfill all of her goals. The secret to her success is her constancy and joy; only through this can she achieve success. She decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy flour wholesale, as well as sugar, honey, trays, etc. María de Jesús hopes that this will allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale, as well as sugar, yeast, and trays.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Ms. Nga is taking out a loan for her daughter, Anh, who is a first year student at Hanoi University for Economics and Technology. 

Anh is studying with Administration and Management faculty. After graduation in 2014, she hopes to find a good job in a factory near her house. Costs like school fees and school supplies make it more difficult for Anh to complete her studies. Nga is requesting a loan of 14,580,000 VND to solve these difficulties.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and school supplies.

loans.name: Phuc

texts.en: Ms Phuc is taking a loan out for her daughter Ngan who is a student at the national university. Ngan is in her last year. She studies with the history faculty. After graduation in October 2012, she will work as a teacher of history. To make the dream come true, she is studying very hard to absorb the best knowledge.  Now she has difficulty in paying her tuition fees and transportation. Therefore, her mother wants to borrow a loan of 10,206,000 Vietnam dong to solve this.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El señor Hector es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene  30 años de edad, está casado hace 3 años con  la señora Cinthia de 25 años, el matrimonio no tiene hijos aun.
La actividad del matrimonio es la venta en forma ambulante  de ropería, bazar, remedios de venta libre, y  hace 3 años que se dedican a este negocio, cuenta con clientela formada y cubre los barrios de la ciudad, para eso dispone de motocicletas en la cual realizan su trabajo. La señora termino una carrera universitaria en pedagogía y ya está empezando a ejercer su profesión realizando reemplazos a otros docentes y su sueño es contar con rubros propios y por ende mejorar sus ingresos.
 Solicita este préstamo para la compra de short, remeras, camisas, ropas interiores, blusas, jarras, latonas, remedios de venta libre y otros artículos que le permitirá ofrecer  a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Hector is from the city of Caaguazú. He is 30, and has been married to Cinthia, age 25, for three years. They do not have any children yet.
This couple sells items door-to-door. They sell clothing, odds and ends, and over-the-counter remedies. They have had this business for three years, and they have a solid customer base. They go to all the neighbourhoods in the city; they have motorcycles to do this. Cinthia has finished a university degree in teaching and is starting to work as a substitute teacher. Her dream is to have her own position and improve her income.
Hector is requesting this loan for the purchase of shorts, t-shirts, shirts, underwear, blouses, jars, bowls, over-the-counter remedies and other items to offer their customers and improve their income.

loans.use: to buy shorts, t-shirts, shirts, underwear, blouses, jars, bowls, over-the-counter remedies and other items.

loans.name: Langoni

texts.en: Langoni is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 25,000 to start another business selling firewood and charcoal.  She wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale. Since her first Kiva loan, Langoni's monthly income has increased greatly. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a student applying for a loan to pay for her tuition fees to help finish her undergraduate degree at Strathmore University. This is her story:

I am Veronica, 20 years of age, from Kenya. I have both my parents and am the first-born of eight siblings. One is in high school, five are in primary school, and the last-born is still too young to go to school. I am a second-year student at Strathmore University, pursuing a degree in Hospitality Management. It has always been my dream to take a Hospitality Management course at a Catholic University that is upscale in ethics and professionalism, and Strathmore University had all that to offer.

I would like to take out this loan so that I can cover my outstanding fee balance, without which I risk discontinuing my studies since the whole family depends on my father for school fees and other expenses. My goals are to enhance my career in the hospitality industry as well as to be an entrepreneur in Fashion and Design. I trust that by attaining this loan the certainty of my dream will be clearer.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees to help her finish an undergraduate degree (Bachelor of Science) in Hospitality Management at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol).
 
Norma se dedica al negocio de hacer manualidades. Ya son varios años que se dedica hacer manualidades. Ella tambien se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Norma requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para seguir elaborando sus manualidades como por ejemplo va comprar papel, tela para seguir haciendo manualidades. 

Norma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norma continues belonging to the communal bank "INTI" of the Arariwa Association of the department of Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is in its third year of operation and it is going well for all of its members. ("Inti" is a word in the Quechua language that translates to the "sun" in English.)

Norma makes handicrafts for a living. She has been making crafts for many years. Norma needs a loan in order to buy materials to continue making her crafts. For example, she is going to buy paper, fabric and other things.

Norma is grateful for the opportunity provided in this method and also promises to comply with the corresponding payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and paper for her handicrafts

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Нуриддин женат и на  воспитании имеет двоих детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и умный человек. Более 7 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота, у него 25 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Жена помогает по бизнесу. А также имеет абрикосовый сад площадью в 1,5 гектар. Нуриддин хотел бы получить займ в размере 8000 Сомони для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Nuriddin is married and provides for two children. He is a very hardworking and intelligent person. For over 7 years, he has been breeding and buying/reselling livestock and currently has 25 head of sheep. His wife helps him with the business. Nuriddin also has an 1.5 hectare apricot orchard. He has requested a loan of 8000 Tajik somoni (TJS) in order to buy cattle. He hopes for your assistance and kindness.

loans.use: To buy livestock for breeding and resale

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 37 años, es una mujer amable y muy buena, esta separada del que fue su conviviente por muchos años y con quien tuvo dos hijos de 17 Gleysi y Cristina de 3 años. Ella como una madre coraje que es, trabaja a diario para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Norma consiste en la venta de comida, tiene un restaurante muy concurrido en su casa en donde trabaja en esta actividad desde hace 13 años. Tiene la ayuda de dos personas a quienes contrata debido a que la demanda por sus platos de comida aumenta cada día más y no se abastece ella sola. Gracias a la ayuda de estas dos personas puede estar mas tranquila ya que respaldan su trabajo.
Está muy contenta con su negocio, pues le permite dar trabajo a personas que desean generar ingresos para su familia, además que le permite estar a lado de sus hijas quienes están en edad de necesitar mucho los sabios consejos de los padres y que les hagan ver el camino a ser personas de bien. Tiene mucho clientes, esto le permite tener muchas venta y mejorar sus ingresos cada día, espera poder mejorar la infraestructura de su local, además de poder hacer crecer su negocio y vender mayor variedad de platos de comida a sus clientes. Este será el quinto préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta por que le brindaran un respaldo financiero y así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual. Esta contenta de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que ve que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos, además cambiará algunos utensilios con los que hace su trabajo.
texts.en:
Norma, 37, is a kind and very good woman.  She is separated from the man with whom she lived for many years and with whom she had two children, Gleysi, 17, and Cristina, 3.  As the brave mother that she is, she works daily to be able to give a better quality of life to her daughters, with whom she lives in her own house.

Norma's job consists of selling food.  She has a very crowded restaurant in her house where she has worked on this activity for 13 years.  She has the help of two people whom she hired because the demand for her dishes increases more every day and she cannot do it alone.  Thanks to the help of these two people she can be calmer, because they support her work.

She is very happy with her business because it allows her to give work to people who want to generate income for their families.  It also allows her to be with her daughters, who are at the age when they need the wise advice of their parents and for their parents to show them the way to being good people.  She has a lot of customers, which allows her to have a lots of sales and improve her income daily.  She hopes to be able to improve the infrastructure of her place, as well as to be able to make her business grow and sell her customers a greater variety of meals.

This will be her fifth loan with MFP.  She is very happy because they give her financial support and so she will be able to increase her working capital.  She knows that she will have to be very responsible and especially very punctual.  She is happy to belong to her communal bank because she sees that they are very supportive.

With the requested sum of 3000 PEN she will buy ingredients and supplies.  She also will change some utensils with which she does her work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food, and to change her kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Marta is one of the members of her group "Mujeres en Desarrollo 1 & 7" (Women in Development).  This group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children and her long term partner. 

Marta is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown in her business and her loan amount. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fruits and vegetables. She operates a vegetables and fruit stall where she sells plantains, cassava, oranges, bananas and other tropical products. Her loan will be used to expand this inventory. She will use the profits to invest in her family expenses and to improve her living condition.  She still dreams of having a successful business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Leónidas Proaño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos son mayores de edad, el menor tiene 16 años y estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja de  tres a cuatro días de la semana en sus visitas ya que cuenta con bastante clientela a quienes les deja mes a mes sus productos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 o 15 días. Tiene más de 4  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y productos naturales. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es ver que su hijo termine sus estudios y sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Leónidas Proaño' community bank meet in the neighborhood of the same name, in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round.  It is known as a city of great beauty which has a lot of tourist attractions.

Here we meet 48-year-old Maria who is married and has five children from her marriage.  Four of her children are adults.  Her youngest is 16 years old and in high school.  Two of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a salesman.

Maria is a housewife who, in order to make her own income and help her husband with their household expenses, sells natural products, Avon products and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics and ladies' accessories).  She works three to four days a week and she has a good number of customers with whom she leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week or fortnight.  She has been in this business for more than four years and it is doing very well.  The products she sells most of are perfumes and cosmetics.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and natural products.  She has been a member of her community bank for five years and she likes it because the repayment terms are easy to meet.

Maria's dream is to see her son finish his studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and natural products

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a student applying for a loan to pay for his tuition fees to help finish his undergraduate degree at Strathmore University. This is his story:

I am 22 years old and a third-year student at Strathmore University pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business and Information Technology. I reside in Nairobi with both of my parents and my six siblings. I am applying for the loan to enable me to pay for my outstanding tuition fees. Based on my parent's current financial situation, this is becoming a hindrance to achieving my goals.

I joined Strathmore to enhance my knowledge as it offers the best opportunity for cultivating innovation. This was after consideration based on review and recommendations I had received about the various institutions around. My great interest in computers was also a complimentary effect as I knew that Strathmore University offers comprehensive tutorship to its students.

My interest in Information Technology is a suitable option for me since it will influence my future personal and career considerations. It will also enhance my business skills as it deals with applications of IT in business. This will help in shaping me as a person and also in giving back to the community and educating my siblings. In the future I intend to venture into entrepreneurship especially in large-scale farming of maize and wheat to help feed the hunger-stricken part of the country.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees to help him finish an undergraduate degree (Bachelor in Business and Information Technology) at Strathmore University

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de bar. Ella vende gaseosas, cervezas y en algunas oportunidades también vende chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz. La socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m. Por medio de este negocio la socia adelante a sus hijos. El sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de bar. La socia solicita el credito para comprar gaseosas y cervezas. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in her bar business.  She sells soda, beer, and sometimes "chicha," which is a corn-based drink.  She serves from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Through this business the member gets her children ahead.  Her dream is to expand her bar business.  

The member is requesting the loan to buy soda and beer.  She is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer.

loans.name: Mgombola Group

texts.en:
Ladislaus, who is in his early 30s, is married. He has been running a business of selling many types of soup (using the head, legs, and intestines of chickens, and cow legs and heads) since 2005. He works from 6:00 am to midnight and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to sell all his types of soup and has paid back his loan successfully. He now wants a loan to buy fish and chicken, some to boil and and the other part to fry and sell it dry. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mgombolwa," which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying their loans.

loans.use: to buy fish and chicken, some to boil and the other part to fry and sell it dry.

loans.name: Nicasio  Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. El socio es el Sr. Nicasio Edgar; el tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesor nombrado, el socio también dicta clases particulares a diferentes alumnos, el socio quiere seguir mejorando como profesor y así de esta manera brindarles una mejor enseñanza a sus alumnos. El socio solicita el préstamo para estudiar un curso de capacitacion en pedagogia.
