El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Senor Pasion Communal Bank. The bank is located in Cusco District, belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department. Sr. Nicasio Edgar is the member. He is 50 years old, married and has 4 children. He alternates his daily activities as an appointed teacher with those where he teaches private lessons to various students. He wants to continue improving as a teacher and providing better instruction to his students. He is requesting a loan for an educational course.

The member is happy with the loan and is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: to take an education course

loans.name: Eufemia Guillerma

texts.es: Eufemia es un mujer de 63 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comercio su historia empezó con una tienda pequeña y poco a poco lo va aumentando a ella le gusto esta actividad, su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, está soltera, si tiene 1 hijo es mayor de edad, su sueño más importante es continuar creciendo su negocio. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para incrementar sus ventas comprando confites, papeleria, dulces.
texts.en: Eufemia is a woman of 63, and she has many aspirations for her business to prosper in the coming years. She began with a little store, and little by little it grew. She likes this business. She does her work alone, and doesn't have any particular problems. She is single and has one son who is an adult. Her most important dream is to continue growing her business. For this reason, she wants the loan to increase her sales by buying hard candies, stationery items, and sweets.

loans.use: to buy hard candies, stationery items, and sweets

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Alejandra; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de profesora en el distrito de Maras, la socia por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere mejorar en su trabajo como profesora estudiando y aprendiendo mas y de esta manera enseñar a sus alumnos, ella hara un curso de capacitacion y requiere el prestamo para invertir en estos estudios. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR PASION” communal bank. The bank is located in the Yucay district, which belongs to the Urubamba province and department of Cuzco.

Her name is Alejandra. She is 37 years old, single and has 1 son. She alternates between her daily activities and her job as a teacher in the district of Maras. She gets her child ahead with this job. She wants to improve her job by studying and learning more and in this way teaching her students.

She is asking for the loan for personal use. She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to pay for a training course

loans.name: Rebbeca

texts.en:
Rebbeca is forty years old and single. For the last ten years she has sold tomatoes in Nakuru and the surrounding area where there is a great demand for them.

Rebbeca was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its field officers, and this 10,000 KES request will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more tomatoes to sell. Her profits will enable her to grow her business and thus increase her income.

In the future, Rebbeca hopes to own various green grocery shops of her own and be able to supply the vegetables, tomatoes and other grocery items to various hotels and institutions in the region.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Abed Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55 years old and married with three children.

Abed Ali has been an owner of a food market since 2000, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has a sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to expand his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to expand his market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jenny Nancy

texts.es:
Jenny es un mujer de 29 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de cosmético Yambal su historia empezó a raíz de su separación con el esposo hace 2 años ya que tenía conocimiento porque el ex esposo le enseño, su trabajo lo hace sola de las 7:30 hasta las 22:00, si tiene dificultades son la casa, está separada, si tiene 1 hijo es mayor de edad.

Su sueño más importante es seguir avanzando con el negocio. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su bazar comprando cosmeticos y perfumes para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 29-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her business selling Yambal cosmetics over the coming years.

Her business story began when she separated from her husband two years ago.  She has knowledge in this field because her husband taught her.  She works alone from 7.30am to 10.00pm.  If she has any difficulties, it would be that she is separated and has one adult child.  Her biggest dream is to continue making progress in her business.  She is requesting this loan for her business and will buy cosmetics and perfumes which will make her more income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Saliz

texts.es:
Saliz, de 70 años, es un hombre bueno, amable y trabajador, a pesar de tener una edad muy avanzada no duda en poder generar sus propios ingresos y no depender de nadie para poder seguir viviendo, es viudo y vive solo en una casa alquilada, tiene dos hijos que son mayores,  trabaja mucho ya que desea juntar algún dinero para poder tener una vejez tranquila. Saliz, todos los días sale al mercado que está mas cerca de su casa, es ahí en donde tiene un pequeño puesto de golosinas, además vende carbón y bebidas, es muy activo ya que siempre está en constante movimiento intentando concretar algún negocio con los clientes. Lleva realizando su trabajo por dos años y durante éste tiempo aprendió a que tiene que tratar bien a los clientes para que puedan volver siempre, trabaja solo ya que así gana más.
Le está yendo muy bien en su negocio, tiene muy buenas ventas y esto le permite tener mejores ingresos, le gustaría aumentar sus productos y ofrecer mayor variedad de cosas y bebidas a sus clientes, es por eso que aun tiene en menta aumentar su negocio y hacerlo crecer, recuerda que antes de empezar con su negocio dependía mucho de lo que sus hijos le daban, pero como siempre fue un hombre fuerte y emprendedor, decidió generar su propios ingresos para no tener que necesitar todo de sus hijos. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte él se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y así seguir siendo un socio puntual como en el crédito anterior que tuvo, durante el primer crédito conoció a sus compañeros de banco comunal y sabe que son muy responsables y solidarios, y es por eso que está muy contento de pertenecer a un grupo tan bueno. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mas productos para poder continuar con su trabajo, comprará mayor variedad de bebidas y aumentara su puesto de golosinas.
texts.en:
Saliz is 70 years old.  He is a good, kind and hard-working man who, in spite of his age, doesn't hesitate to make his own income so that he doesn't have to depend on anybody to continue living.  He is a widower and lives alone in a rental house.  He has two adult children and works hard because he would like to put together some money so that he can enjoy a peaceful old age.  

Saliz goes out every day to the market nearest his home.  There he has a small candy stall where he also sells charcoal and drinks.  He is very active as he is always in constant movement, making some deal with his customers.  He has been in his business for two years and, during this time, he has learned that he has to provide good customer service if he wants his customers to return to his business.  He works alone as this makes him more money.  Saliz's business is doing very well.  He makes good sales which allows him to make more income.  He would like to increase the number of products he sells and offer his customers a larger number of products.  He would like to increase and grow his business.  He remembers that before he started this business he depended a lot on his children.  However, as he was always a strong and entrepreneurial man, he decided to make his own income so that he wouldn't be dependent on his children.

This will be Saliz's fifth loan from MFP and he hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can continue achieving his goals.  For his part, he pledges to make his repayments on time and continue being a punctual client as he was with his previous loan.  During his first loan cycle he got to know the other members of his community bank.  He knows that they are responsible and very supportive people.  For this reason, he is very happy to belong to his group.  He will use his 2,500 soles to buy more products so that he can continue in his work and buy a wider variety of drinks.  He will also expand his candy business.

loans.use: to buy more soda and candies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tree seedlings.

loans.name: Francisca Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Leónidas Proaño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Francisca, tiene 46 años  de edad, es soltera y vive sola en un departamento que arrienda. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella empezó su negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida de una forma honrada, por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución. 

Ella para obtener sus ingresos para ganarse la vida se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días unas  cuatro horas  diarias, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería sobretodo de temporada, como bermudas, trajes de baño, camisetas, entre otras prendas.
 
 Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y una boutique o almacén.
texts.en:
Leónidas Proaño Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of the same name in the city of Manta, known for its pretty beaches that are visited frequently in every season of the year and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Here we met Francisca.  She is 46 years old and single, and lives in an apartment that she rents.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because with one of the loans she began her business, which allows her to earn a living honorably.  For this she is very grateful to the institution.

She works door-to-door selling all types of clothing to earn her income to make a living.  She works every day, some four hours a day.  She leaves things on credit and charges every week.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise when she needs it.  She has been doing this work for five years and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, especially seasonal items such as bermuda shorts, bathing suits,and  t-shirts, among other articles of clothing.

Her dreams are to have her own house and boutique or grocery store.

loans.use: to buy bermuda shorts, bathing suits, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Joba Ysabel

texts.es:
Joba Ysabel es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad con quienes vive es un caserío rural de nombre “San Pedrillo 176 –B” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande y el mismo a la provincia de Piura, actualmente su caserío cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica.


Su actividad económica de Joba Ysabel es el de dedicarse a la crianza de animales menores como: ovinos, porcinos, y aves de corral en su mayoría, pues el trabajo que realiza es de bastante sacrificio ya que tiene que alimentar y cuidar hasta alcancen el tamaño y el peso ideal para poder ofrecerlos a los mercados locales o tener que salir a buscar clientes en mercados de otros caseríos. Su esposo actualmente apoya a generar otros ingresos dedicándose a trabajar como jornalero en diferentes fundos de la zona.

Joba Isabel desea hacer cada día mas grande su negocio por lo que se ha dispuesto a solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles los cuales empleará para la compra de alimentos balanceados con los que tendrán un mejor engorde sus animales y así puedan ofrecer mejores precios, la inversión realizada le traerá como consecuencia aumentar sus utilidades por lo que mejorará sus condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Joba Ysabel is a 29 year old mother who has 2 young children. They live in a rural hamlet called San Pedrillo 176-B which is in the district of Tambogrande and the province of Piura. Currently, their community has basic electrical service.
Joba Ysabel works raising small animals such as: sheep, pigs, and poultry. This work is quite hard as she has to feed and care for the animals until they reach the ideal size and weight for them to be offered for sale at the local markets or she has to go looking for customers at markets in other villages. Her husband currently helps with the family income working as a laborer on various farms in the area.
Joba Ysabel wants to grow her business every day, and so she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for $375 which she will use to buy balanced animal feed that will enable her animals to grow fat so that she can get better prices for them. This investment will bring her bigger profits and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Aereopaquita Nidia

texts.es: Areopaquita Nidia es una emprendedora que con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de ropa usada, a esta emprendedora se le ha apoyado en el financiamiento para que ella invierta en el negocio en la compra mercadería para invertir en el negocio. Durante el tiempo que ha tenido el financiamiento ha demostrado ser una personas responsable y con buenos valores y con un record crediticio intachable. Actualmente la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, camisetas entre una gran variedad de ropa en general.
texts.en: Areopaquita Nidia is an entrepreneur who has worked hard to set up a business selling used clothing.  This entrepreneur has used loans to buy merchandise to invest in her business.  During her loan cycles, she has shown herself to be a responsible person with good values and an impeccable credit history.  This entrepreneur is currently requesting a loan to invest in her business.  She will buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, t-shirts as well as other articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, t-shirts and other clothing

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 28 years old and single. He has been in the phone repair business in Nakuru town for the last 5 years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more phone accessories and spare parts for use in his business.

In the future, Jeremiah hopes to expand his business and open a phone selling shop to make more income.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Arame ; elle est mariée et mère de famille .Elle habite dans un petit village situé à environ 17 km de la ville principale. Elle est marchande depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente d’aliments pour bétails, mais vent aussi de l’huile d’arachide transformé localement. C’est en accompagnant souvent sa mère au marché, qu’elle a pris l’habitude et a appris le métier.
Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Avec ses bénéfices elle arrive à mettre de l’argent de coté pour que ultérieurement elle puisse ouvrir une boutique d' alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This is Arame.  She is married and has a family.  She lives in a small village located about 17 kilometers away from the main city.  She has been working as a seller for more than 5 years.  She is involved in the sale of cattle feed, and also sells locally processed groundnut oil.  She got accustomed to her trade and learned it while frequently accompanying her mother to the market.
Arame helps her husband to manage the family's daily expenses.  With her profits, she is able to save some money which she hopes to use to open a general food store in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and locally processed oil.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, de 69 años, es un hombre amable y trabajador, esta casado con Emma de 63 años y con quien tiene cinco hijos a quienes crió, educo y brindo siempre lo mejor hasta el momento que fueron mayores e independientes. Él vive a lado de su esposa en su casa propia en donde trabaja a diario para poder mejorar su condicion de vida. El trabajo de Roberto, consiste en la venta de productos naturales curativos, trabaja con una empresa internacional que le abastece de un novedoso y buen producto el cual contiene propiedades curativas y de consumo para todas edades y todos los miembros de las familias, todos los días él sale a las calle a ofrecer su producto. Lleva realizando dos años este trabajo que le permite tener tranquilidad y comodidad, antes tenia el trabajo de soldador pero con el tiempo el brillo de la soldadura deterioro su vista quedando en algún momento sin poder ver absolutamente nada. Como siempre fue un hombre perseverante y fuerte hizo todo lo posible para poder recuperarse y ahora que esta mucho mejor, tiene una nueva forma de ganarse la vida. Le va bien en su trabajo, en base a mucho esfuerzo logro hacerse de una buena cartera de clientes que le permite tener buenas ventas y con lo mismo mejorar sus ingresos, desea poder seguir trabajando y poder aumentar su cantidad de productos ya que cada día crecen mas la cantidad de clientes de su negocio. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura d avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado ella se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo ya que ahí son muy puntuales. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mas productos para asi poder ofrecer en mayor cantidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Roberto, 69, is a kind and hardworking man.  He is married to Emma, 63, with whom he has five children, whom he raised, educated, and always gave the best until the moment they were of age and independent.  He lives with his wife in his own house where he works daily to be able to improve his living conditions.

Roberto's job consists of selling natural curative products.  He works with an international company that supplies him with an innovative and good product that contains curative properties for all ages and all members of the family.  Every day he goes out on the streets to offer his product.  He has been doing this work for two years, which allows him to have peace and comfort.

Previously he had a job as a welder, but in time the brightness of the welding deteriorated his vision, resulting in him not being able to see anything at all at one point.  As he always was a persevering and strong man, he did everything possible to be able to recover, and now he is much better.  He has a new way to earn a living.

It is going well for him in his job.  On the basis of a lot of effort he managed to get himself a good portfolio of customers, which allows him to have good sales and, thus, improve his income.  He wants to be able to continue working and be able to increase his quantity of products, because every day the number of customers for his business grows.

This will be his third loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he will have some financial help because in this way he will feel more secure about advancing with his business.  On the other hand, he promises once again to make his payments punctually because he does not want to lose face with his group, as they are very punctual there.

With the requested sum of 1000 PEN he will buy more products and so be able to offer large amounts to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more natural products.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha,  tiene una frial - carnicería donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, tienen  este negocio hace cuatro años, ella tiene 57 años esta separada de su esposo y tiene 2 hijos ya mayores e independientes que le ayudan en el negocio, la Sra. Martha  siempre tiene los mejores productos en embutidos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella vive en la zona de alto Pampahasi que esta ubicada a 25 minutos del centro de la ciudad. Ella trabaja actualmente mucho para tener un buen capital y mercadería. Pero ya que en estas fechas incrementa su venta de salchichas tiene que incrementar sus pedidos por esta razón solicita el crédito para la compra de una maquina fiambrera para cortar embutidos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y amable y en el tiempo que trabaja con créditos de emprender siempre a demostrado ser puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Martha has a business selling cold cuts and meats.  She sells a variety of basic household products and has run her business for four years.  
She is 57 years old, separated from her husband, and has two children who are adults, live independently, and help her in her business.  Martha always has the best cold cuts to offer her customers.  She lives in Alto Pampahasi district, 25 minutes from the city center. She currently works hard to have good capital and merchandise available.  Right now, her sausage sales are increasing and she has to increase her orders.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a delicatessen machine with which to cut her cold meats.  She is a very hard-working and kind person and, since she has taken out loans with Emprender, she has shown herself to be punctual and responsible.

loans.use: to buy a delicatessen machine

loans.name: Wangninan Group

texts.fr: WANGNINAN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres mènent les mêmes activités génératrices de revenus et ont les mêmes affinités parentales. La représentante du groupe, Towédé Ephrasie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans. Towédé Ephrasie est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Julien. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Towédé Ephrasie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants ; et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges familiales. Towédé Ephrasie n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Towédé Ephrasie vend depuis sept ans environs, de l'huile à moteur au Bénin. Towédé Ephrasie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Towédé Ephrasie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été déjà remboursés.
texts.en: WANGNINAN is a group which consists of three members who are involved in the same money-making activities and share family bonds.  The facilitator of the group, Towédé Ephrasie (raising her hand in the photo), is 30 years old and married to a driver named Julien.  The couple has three children, all in school and all their dependents. Towédé Ephrasie lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses together with her husband.  She has never attended school.  To meet her various needs, she has been selling motor oil in Benin for about seven years.  She stocks up in a town of Benin.  In order to strengthen her business and to better meet her customers' needs, she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the WANGNINAN group.  Previous loans have already been repaid.

loans.use: to buy cans of motor oil.

loans.name: Mahougnon 2 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans la même localité. La représentante du groupe, Elise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans. Elise est mariée à un certain Daniel. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Elise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Elise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Elise vend depuis une quinzaine d’année, des  produits vivriers à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Elise vend de l’igname frit et des beignets de haricot à son domicile. Elise s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité,  Elise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON 2 un troisième  crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire. Les deux crédits passés dont Elise avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: MAHOUGNON 2 is a group which consists of three members who live in the same area.  The facilitator of the group, Elise (raising her hand in the photo) is 48 years old and married to a man named Daniel.  The couple has three children who all attend school.  Elise lives with her husband and children.  The couple takes care of the various household expenses together.  Elise has never attended school.  In order to cover her various expenses, she has been selling food products from home for about fifteen years.  Additionally, she also sells fried yams and bean fritters from home.  She stocks up in various regions in Benin. In order to strengthen her business and to increase her turnover, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the MAHOUGNON 2 group.  The two previous loans granted to Elise have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy food products and bags of yams.

loans.name: Emelia Ekua

texts.en: Emelia Ekua sells bags at Krofofordo near Abura. She has been in this business for 4 years now.  She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a machine operator. Emelia uses her income to support her husband and pay their utility bills. She will use the requested loan to purchase a variety of bags to satisfy her customers' needs. She plans to expand her business with the new profits this will generate.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bags to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama cooks banku for sale.  She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Krofofodo near Abura.  She has been in this business for 20 years now.  

Mariama is a widow and has 3 children.  As a single parent, she uses her income to for the general upkeep of ther children.  Her loan will be used to  purchase bags of maize and fish, which she will use to prepare her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to build a better stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: buy maize and fish

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen tiene 33 años y es soltera no tiene hijos por ahora ya con el tiempo ella desea formar una familia, ella se dedica a la agricultura tiene una parcela que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de el  playón, es cliente nueva de la institución, la Sra. Carmen solicita este préstamo para la compra de semillas para  siembra de  papa y los gastos que implica la cosecha  de arroz, esta es la única actividad que ella tiene para mantenerse, para salir adelante ya que ella  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza, una ves cosechado venderá sus productos directamente del productor al consumidor, en el mercado de la zona, la Sra. Carmen se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Carmen is 33 years old and single. She doesn't have children yet but in time she wishes to start a family. She's a farmer who owns a plot of land located in the community of El Playón. She's a new client of the institution. Carmen requests this loan in order to purchase seeds for sowing potatoes and to pay for the costs of harvesting rice. This business is her only means of living and getting ahead, since she faces challenges in her business, such as lifting herself out of poverty. Once her crop is harvested, she will sell it directly from farmer to consumer at the local market. Carmen is happy and thankful for the opportunity she is given.

loans.use: to sow potatoes and to harvest rice.

loans.name: América Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Leónidas Proaño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora América, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella junto al esposo tienen un negocio de venta de huevos y queso, todos los días ellos se desplazan por toda la ciudad en su carro vendiendo estos productos que son muy consumidos por la población,  realizan muchas ventas y tienen muchos clientes que les compran, ya que el queso que venden es deliciosos y esto es porque ellos viajan hasta la ciudad de Chone donde se consigue el mejor queso y esto les agrada a sus clientes, ellos llevan 7 años dedicado a esta actividad comercial y les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar quesos y huevos para la venta. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es comprar otro carro o tener un local.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Leónidas Proaño" meets every 15 days in the neighborhood that carries the same name in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that attract visitors in every season of the year, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Here we meet America, who is 29.  She is in a common-law marriage that has produced two children, aged 10 and 5, who are in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Along with her husband, America has a business selling eggs and cheese.  Every day they travel throughout the city in their car, selling these products, which are consumed a lot by the local residents.  They make a lot of sales and they have a lot of customers who buy from them, because the cheese that they sell is delicious.  This is because they travel to the city of Chone to get the best cheese to please their customers.  America and her husband have been doing this type of work for 7 years, and it is going very well.

This loan will be used to buy cheese and eggs to sell.  America has been with her communal bank through 4 loan cycles, and she likes it because of the assistance that they provide with the loans.

Her dream is to buy another car, or to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy cheese and eggs to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has operated a shoe sales business in Nakuru for the last 10 years. He is 34 years old and married to Hellen with three school-going children.

Besides the shoe sales business, his primary activity, he also sells clothes and electronics. He was introduced to Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, by one of its field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more shoes for sale, with part of it to buy more clothes and electronics.

In the future, Charles hopes to expand his business and open a supermarket to become one of the leading entrepreneurs in the region.

loans.use: To increase his stock of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 43, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Alfonso, her business partner, and is a mother of seven children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilou operates a handicrafts business. What she basically does is buy raw materials used in craft-making from suppliers, then manufacture them into different products and sell them per piece with a profit.   The products can range from lantern, lampshade and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are the local community members.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Marilou is requesting a PHP 9, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials and supplies needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marilou dreams to expand her business and help her children finish their studies through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy crafts materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther operates a grocery shop at Krofododo near Abura.  She has done this for 5 years now.   The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of soft  drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.  

Esther is married and has 1 child.  Her husband is a driver.  Esther uses her income to support her husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Esther plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy grocery items

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 21 year to 30 years. He describes himself to be ambitious and optimistic. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as maize flour, cooking fat, salt, royco, etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of items. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more home products. His business goal is to expand his business and venture into a new business of motorcycle transportation within 5 years.

loans.use: buy products to sell

loans.name: 04.08.01 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hạnh is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children. Hạnh is the group leader of the 04.08.01-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Hạnh lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hạnh has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hạnh is applying for a loan to purchase dry food and goods for resale. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling dry food and goods for resale. Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and goods for resale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 56, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines.  She is a widow and mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edna operates a market stall. She sells fruit and vegetable products in the community market. She buys quantities of fruits and vegetables and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Edna is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Edna dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Farhad

texts.ru: Sfera deyatelnosti Farhada yavlaetsa remontom mashin. Po specialnosti on slesar. Emu 26 let, on jenat I u nego odin rebenok. Farhad otkril svoe delo 3 goda nazad. On arenduet pomeshenie dla avtomasterskoy, na budushee on planiruet uluchshit  dela v biznese I postroit svoyu sobstvennuyu avtomasterskuyu. On schitaet chto potrachenniye dengi za arendu cekha mojno  potratit na semyu. Segodna emu nujni dengi v summe 250 AZN dla togo chtobi kupit avtozapchasti dla mashin. Farhad lubit svoyu rabotu i nadeetsa chto ego ideyi budut voplashatsa v realnost.
texts.en: Farhad's area of expertise is automotive repair, he works as a mechanic. He is 26 years old, married, and has one child. Farhad opened his business 3 years ago. He currently rents space for his shop, but is planning to improve his business and build his own garage. He believes that the money he pays in rent would be better spent on his family. Today, he needs 250 AZN to purchase auto parts. Farhad loves his work and hopes that his dreams will come true.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama produces kenkey for sale.  In front of Ama is the maize she uses in her kenkey production.  Ama is married to a farmer and has 6 dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the family.  She needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production.  With the new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has four children.

Ali has been the owner of a car painting workshop since 1996.  He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs.  He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Ali decided to apply for $3000 loan in order to renovate his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: renovate his car painting workshop

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en: Jesse is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as a principled man. He operates a nissan through which he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high price of inputs such as fuel. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase spare parts. Jesse's  business goal is to buy another car within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Elavagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ELAVAGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Brice, est celui  dont la main est levée sur la photo. Brice est âgé de 40 ans et est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Clarisse. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Brice vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges de la famille. Brice a arrêté l’école au niveau universitaire. Il y a huit ans que Brice mène comme activité, la vente de produits congelés dans son quartier. Brice s'approvisionne au  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Brice sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ELAVAGNON, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: ELAVAGNON is a group which consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  The facilitator of this group, Brice, (raising his hand in the photo), is 40 years old and married to a reseller named Clarisse.  The couple has three children, all in school and all their dependents.  Brice lives with his wife and children and takes care of the various family expenses with his wife.  Brice stopped studying at the university level.  For the past eight years he has been selling frozen products in his neighborhood.  He stocks up in Benin.  In order to meet his customers' needs and to increase his turnover and income, he has requested a fifth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the ELAVAGNON group.  Previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy frozen products.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has one child.

Mohamad has been a tailor since 2008; he makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, such as suits, coats and trousers for men. He has more than four years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop and to add more goods. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life on the whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent for his workshop and to add more goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke, age 40, has spent her life dedicated to rice farming in the Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Ke is married to her husband who works in the same type of business and is blessed with 2 single children. Moreover, besides this business, Ke’s husband is involved in performing construction tasks with his building team from place to place around the province, but presently he’s experiencing difficulties in transportation to his workplace due to the lack of a family-owned vehicle.

To solve this problem, Ke wants to obtain a loan from HKL to purchase a motorcycle to support in her husband’s business. She is very appreciated of our lenders who help poor family like hers.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Constructor Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONSTRUCTOR II” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Catalina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chuño, elaboración de sombreros, manta a macramé, venta de pantalones, venta de ajuares de bebé.

La señora Catalina, indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de sombreros que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su jefe anterior.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de las ferreterías, por mayor, y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía esta ausenta la señora Paulina por razones culturales.
texts.en:
Communal bank "Constructor II" ("Builder II") will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focus center Los Andes. It is comprised of seven members and directed by a board headed by Catalina. The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied. Among them are selling chuño (freeze dried potato flour), making hats, sewing macramé blankets, selling pants and selling layettes.
Catalina reports that she has been working with Pro Mujer for two years and that she became a part of the institution because she was invited by a promoter. She currently owns a hat making business. She's been in this line of work for years and she learned it from her former boss.
The loan she requests now is to increase her working capital by purchasing leather from hardware stores by wholesale. After crafting it, she will sell it in her sales booth. This line of work allows her to get an income in order to support her family, since she's married and has three children.
When asked about what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services. 
In the picture, Paulina is absent due to cultural reasons.

loans.use: to purchase leather.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells a local drink popularly known as Awusa beer at Krofofordo near Abura.  She has been in this business for 6 years now.  She is married  and has 3 children.  Her husband is a mason.   Araba uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use the loan to purchase the ingredients needed to produce the drink for sale. She plans to expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make Awusa beer

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 38-year-old married man. He has 2 children who are 2 and 13 years old. He describes himself as dedicated to his work. He operates a food stall from which he sells food, tea and snacks. He has been involved in this business for 6 years and employs 3 staff members. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers visit frequently. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more ingredients for food. His business goal is to run another food stall within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as maize flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Farhodjon

texts.ru: Фарходжон женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Более 7 лет занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством. Фарходжон хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы его дети получили образование в институтах. В бизнесе помогают жена и сын, и они вместе дружно работают. Данный момент у него 2 голов крупного рогатого скота. Фарходжон запрашивает займ в размере 4 голов мелкого рогатого скота для расширения бизнеса с целью получения больше доходов для семьи. Фарходжон надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Farhodjon is married and a responsible father of three children. For more than seven years he has been cultivating crops. He also raises livestock. Farhodjon would like to expand his business so that his children can receive post-secondary education. His wife and son help him with the business, and the three of them work well together. Currently, Farhodjon has three cows. He is requesting a loan equivalent to the price of 4 sheep and/or goats in order to expand his business and earn more money for his family. Farhodjon hopes for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: 3.12.126.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Binh  has a retail business selling dry food and dry goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase products to resell.  Binh  has been involved in this business for 7 years.

Binh is 35 years old and she is married with 1 child.  She is the group leader of the 3.12.126.TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Binh  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  The main hardship that Binh  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Binh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to build a new house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: buy dry food and dry goods

loans.name: Ihssan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has two children.

Ihssan is the owner of an upholstery workshop since 2006. He has more than five years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Ihssan decided to apply for $3000 in loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop and to purchase an electric generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: pay shop rent and buy a generator

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica, de 38 años, siempre fue una mujer de carácter fuerte, no le tiene miedo al trabajo y siempre está alegre viendo el lado positivo de la vida. Está casada con Arturo de 28 años con quien tiene dos hijos, Gino de 17 años e Ingrid de 15, ella vive a lado de su familia en su casa propia y a diario trabaja mucho ya que desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Jessica consiste en el la venta de comida, desde muy temprano se va al mercado en busca de los ingredientes mas frescos e insumos mas selectos para así brindar un buen producto. Una vez en su casa prepara y sale a vender a sus clientes quienes le son muy fieles ya que saben que sus sazón es buena y tiene un trato único con ellos. Todo esté trabajo lo hace en su casa ella sola. Lleva realizando esté trabajo por un año, antes se dedica a la venta de abarrotes pero el trabajo le tenía mucho tiempo ocupado.
Le gusta lo que hace pues le permite disponer de su tiempo, le está yendo bien ya que genera buenos ingresos a la economía de su hogar, tiene como planes a futuro el de poder poner una restaurante en su casa, pero sabe que es un proceso que será un poco largo así que por ahora solo quiere seguir consolidándose y aumentar de a poco la variedad de platos que brindar a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y así seguir siendo una socia puntual como en el crédito anterior que tuvo, durante el primer crédito conoció a sus compañeros de banco comunal y sabe que son muy responsables y solidarios, y es por eso que está muy contenta de pertenecer a un grupo tan bueno. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará ingredientes no perecibles, para así tener en stcok, ya que en las temporadas de lluvia como ahora lo precio suben demasiado y no le dejan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Jessica, who is 38 years old, has always been a woman of strong character.  She is not afraid of work and is always happy seeing the positive side of life.  She is married to Arturo, who is 28 years old, and they have two children, Gino who is 17 and Ingrid who is 15.  Jessica lives beside her family in her own home and works hard daily since she wants to bring her family a better quality of life.  Jessica's job consists of selling food.  Early in the morning she goes to the market looking for the freshest ingredients and the most select items in order to bring forth a good product.  Once she returns home she prepares everything and goes out to sell to her clients who are very loyal since they know that her flavors are good and she treats her clients the best.  She does all of this work on her own at home.  She has been doing this work for one year.  Before that she worked selling groceries but that job was never-ending.  She likes what she does now since it permits her to have some free time.  It is going well for her as she is generating good income for her family.  Her plans for the future include opening a restaurant in her house, but she knows it is a process that will take a long time so for now she just wants to continue consolidating and growing a little bit the variety of dishes that she offers to her customers.  This will be her third credit with MFP, and she is hoping that with your help she will be able to reach her goals.  For her part, she promises to complete her scheduled payments and continue being a punctual group member like she was with her previous credit.  With the first loan she met other members of the communal bank and she knows that they are all very responsible and committed, and for that reason she is very happy to belong to such a good group.  With the requested loan of 2000 Peruvian soles, she will buy non-perishable ingredients, so that she will have them in stock, since during the rainy season like right now prices go up a lot and don't allow for good earnings.

loans.use: To buy perishable ingredients and imperishable items for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Damir

texts.ru: Дамир- молодой человек 26 лет, женат имеет одного ребёнка. Он с юности был учеником у одного мастера по производству национальных сундуков. Национальные сундуки являются предметом обихода и используются таджиками для хранения приданного для невест, а также являются подарком для дочери, когда она выходит замуж. После шестимесячного обучения он самостоятельно начал своё производство. В начале своей деятельности ему было туговато, из-за малой клиентуры. Но после одного года работы, у него появились свои покупатели, которые постоянно заказывают ему сундуки. Товары его производства имеют хорошее качество, он использует хорошую древесину. А также разнообразные красивые орнаменты и узоры по обработке лицевой стороны сундуков. На полученный кредит он хочет купить три кубометра древесины, для увеличения своего производства.
texts.en: Damir is a young man of 26, he is married and has a child. Since youth, he apprenticed with a master craftsman who made traditional chests. These chests are household objects and are used by Tajiks to store a bride's dowry, and also serve as a gift for a daughter when she gets married. After six months of training, Damir began manufacturing the chests on his own. In the beginning, things were difficult due to limited clientele. However, after working for one year, Damir acquired his own customers who regularly place orders for his chests. He makes a high-quality product and uses good wood, as well as a variety of ornaments and designs to decorate the chests' fronts. Using this loan, Damir would like to buy three cubic meters of lumber to increase production.

loans.use: to purchase three cubic meters of lumber

loans.name: Hawasatu

texts.en: Hawasatu is a seamstress who sells fabrics in Krofofordo near Abura. She has been in this business for 7 years now. Hawasatu is married with 1 child. Her husband is an account clerk. She uses her income to assist her husband and pay their accommodation bills. Hawasatu needs this loan to purchase more fabric to sell and for sewing. With the new profits, Hawasatu will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric to sell and for sewing

loans.name: Sedjro Group

texts.fr: SEDJRO est un groupe de sept personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Victorine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans. Victorine est mariée à un mécanicien du  nom de Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Victorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Victorine mène comme activité la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine et de fruits de façon ambulante. Victorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle, Victorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEDJRO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été déjà remboursé.
texts.en: SEDJRO is a group made up of seven members who live in the same neighborhood.  The facilitator of the group, Victorine (raising her hand in the photo), is 39 years old and married to a mechanic named Jean.  The couple has four children, all in school and all their dependents.  Victorine lives with her husband and children.  Together with her husband, she takes care of the various household expenses.  Victorine has never attended school.  In order to cover her various expenses, she sells kitchen utensils and fruits, door-to-door.  She stocks up at a market in Benin.  In order to boost her activity level and to attract more customers, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the SEDJRO group.  Her previous loan has already been repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Villa Rica Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Yoselyn Marcelina, tiene 21 años de edad, convive con su pareja y estan esperando su primer bebe. Ella forma parte del grupo "Villa Rica", formado por 7 integrantes residentes del distrito de Carabayllo.
La Sra. Yoselyn Marcelina, desde hace dos años y medio maneja una bodega, ubicada en su domicilio, inició este negocio de a pocos, empezando con golosinas.
Le gustaría hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar el ambiente destinado, y con sus ingresos y ganancia poder ayudar a su pareja a construir su casita.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Señora Yoselyn Marcelina is 21 years old. She lives with her partner and they are expecting their first baby. She forms part of the group "Villa Rica," which is formed by seven members who are residents of the district of Carabayllo.

For two and a half years Señora Yoselyn Marcelina has been managing a store located in her house. She set up this business with just a little, beginning with candy.

She would like to make her business grow, improve the atmosphere of the assigned area, and with her income and earnings be able to help her husband build their little house.

She will invest the loan she will receive in the purchase of soft drinks.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of soft drinks

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua produce fanti kenkey (a staple dish in West Africa) for sale at Krofofrodo near Abura. In the photo, Efua is mixing the dough she uses for her kenkey. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has been selling fanti kenkey for some years now. She uses her income to support her husband and pay their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to increase her production of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to produce more kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Luisa Janely

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Leónidas Proaño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Luisa, tiene 36 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una  hija de 12 años de edad que estudian en colegio. Vive en casa de sus padres con su hija y una hermana. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido salir adelante ya que con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.

Ella es una muy buena madre  que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto sacar adelante a su hija se dedica a la venta de ropa. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, la mayor parte de sus ventas las realza bajo pedido que le realizan sus clientes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 15 días. Viaja a Quito o  Ambato a comprar su mercadería. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto está sacando adelante sola a su hija. Lo que más vende es la ropa de dormir.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. 

Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The community bank Leónidas Proaño meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of the same name in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular all year round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 
Here we met Luisa, who is 36 years old and the single mother of a 12 year old daughter who is in high school. She lives with her parents along with her daughter and a sister. She has been a member of the community bank for 2 years and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she has been successful and she started her business with the first loan.
She is a very good mother who, in order to get her own resources and bring up her daughter right, sells clothes. She sells from door to door and works three days a week for two or three hours a day. Most of her sales are made based on orders that her customers place. She sells her goods on credit and collects every two weeks. She travels to Quito and Ambato to buy her merchandise. She has been doing this for 2 years and, thanks to this, she is able to bring up her daughter alone. She mostly sells sleep ware.
This loan will be used to by clothing of all types. 
Her dream is to give her daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothes.

loans.name: Nonvigbe Group

texts.fr: NONVIGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Eudoxie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans. Eudoxie est mariée à un certain Léon.  Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Eudoxie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Eudoxie a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Eudoxie vend depuis dix ans, du maïs et des fruits de saison dans sa région. Eudoxie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle, Eudoxie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGBE un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: NONVIGBE is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  The facilitator of the group, Eudoxie, is 47 years old and raising her hand in the photo.  She is married to a man named Léon.  Eudoxie and Léon have three children, all in school and all their dependents.  Eudoxie lives with her husband and children.  The couple takes care of the various household expenses together.  Eudoxie left school at the secondary level.  In order to cover her diverse expenses, she has been selling maize and seasonal fruits, in her region, for the past ten years.  She stocks up at a market in Benin.  In order to boost her business and to better meet the needs of her customers, she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the NONVIGBE group.  Previous loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize and seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Olga Alicia

texts.es:
Olga Alicia de 28 años, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 8 años de edad, uno de ellos estudia, vive con su familia en aldea Antigual de Bonito Oriental, Colon. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Olga motivada por obtener más ingresos para el hogar se ha dedicado a vender cosméticos, lociones, cremas, champú y otros de productos AVON, adicionalmente vende recargas para celulares. A esta actividad le dedica 6 horas diarias y sus ventas son a domicilio y por pedidos.
Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF para invertir en su negocio, del cual va comprar cremas, lociones, desodorantes etc. para cumplir con los pedidos hechos de los clientes.
Ella espera superarse y tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Olga Alicia is 28 years old and is married.  She has two children aged 4 and 8 years old, one of whom is in school.  She lives with her family in the village of El Antigual de Bonito Oriental, in Colon.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Motivated to earn more income for her household, Olga has dedicated herself to selling cosmetics, lotions, creams, shampoo and other Avon products.  She also sells cellphone chargers.  She works six hours a day doing this and makes her sales at home or by orders.

She is requesting a second loan from ODEF to invest in her business, with which she will purchase creams, lotions, deodorants, etc. to fulfill the customer orders she has in place.

She hopes to excel and to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, lotions, creams, deodorants, etc. to stock up her business.

loans.name: Despertar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DESPERTAR” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gabriela es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pollos, venta de calzados, producción de calzados, producción de mantas, venta de CD’s, venta de comida, venta de ropa.

La señora Gabriela,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados que viene trabajando hace años, mismo que aprendió de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de calzados) que adquiere de los mayoristas  y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio de salud.
texts.en:
The community bank Despertar will soon start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer. It is part of the Villa Tejada group and is comprised of 8 members and is directed by a board of directors of which Gabriela is the secretary. The members run a variety of businesses including: selling chickens, selling shoes, making shoes, making blankets, selling CDs, selling food, and selling clothes.
Gabriela says that this is the first loan cycle that the group has had and that she joined the group on the invitation of a friend. Currently, she has a business selling shoes and she has been doing this for years, having learned the trade from her parents. 
She is requesting a loan to increase her capital for buying shoes, which she buys from the wholesalers and then sells from her stall. This works enables hear to generate income to support her family. 
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health clinic.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: 03.12.125. Tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lien  has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. She is 33 years old and married with 2 children. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Lien is the leader of the 3.12.125 Tt Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

In 2010, Lien joined Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lien has been involved in her tailoring business for 7 years. The main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Lien hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to remodel her house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 34 years old. She is married with three children. She is a farmer and has been in this business for the past 12 years. She was brought to Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, by a field officer. This is her second loan and she repaid the previous loan on schedule. She will use the new loan to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, de 59 años, es una mujer muy amable, buen y emprendedora, es madre de siete hijos a quien educo hasta su mayoría de edad, ahora solo tiene a una menor llamada Kaori de 14 años en su poder, siempre ha vivido a lado de Armando su esposo de 58 años con quien ha trabajado para poder brindar una buena educación y crianza a sus hijos. Hace mucho años atrás, Reyna tenía un negocio bueno y prospero, se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes, tenia una tienda muy grande y surtida, lamentablemente tuvo una enfermedad que termino en cama por mucho tiempo y debido a esto su negocio cayo y no pudo levantarlo mas. Es así como hace 18 años decidió iniciar uno nuevo, pero uno que no le dedicara todo el tiempo, sino que le permitiera descansar, es así como empezó a trabajar con su nuevo negocio que al principio solo lo hacia los fines de semana pero con el tiempo fue haciendo en días intercalados. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de patasca (sopa de la sierra), en nuestra ciudad hay muchas personas que son de esa parte de nuestro país y van muy seguido en busca de encontrar un plato preparado como les gustas, con buena sazón y con excelente trato. Lleva realizando éste nuevo trabajo por 198 años y tiene la ayuda de su esposo.
Le está yendo muy bien, tiene muchas ventas y con esto genera buenos ingresos, desea mas adelante agrandar su negocio y preparar más variedad de platos y así tener mejor atendidos a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas asegura de avanzar con su negocio, por su parte se compromete una vez mas a seguir siendo una socia cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas, está muy contenta de trabajar junto a los de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy solidarios y muy responsables.
Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para continuar con su trabajo, además de preparar mayor variedad de platos de comida.
texts.en:
Reyna is 59 years old and a very kind, good, and enterprising woman. She is the mother of 7 children who she raised until they were grown-up. Now she only has one child at home, 14 year old Kaori. She has always lived alongside Armando, her husband, with whom she has worked to be able to offer a good education and upbringing to their children. Many years ago, Reyna had a good and prosperous business selling groceries. She had a very large and well-stocked store. Unfortunately, she had an illness that left her bedridden for a long time and so her business fell and she could no longer run it. As a result, 18 years ago, she decided to start a new business, one that she wouldn't have to work at all the time, but rather one that would enable her to rest. This is how she started to work in her new business that, at the start, she only did at the weekends. With time, she started working on alternating days. She works selling patasca (a soup from the mountains). In our city, there are many people from this part of out country and they very often go in search of dishes that are prepared the way that they like, with good seasoning and well made. She has been running this new business for 18 years and her husband helps her. 
The business is going very well and she has good sales that bring her a good income. For the future, she'd like to grow her business and make a greater variety of dishes and so better serve her customers. This will be her fourth loan from MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as she feels more sure that she can move her business forward. For her part, she promises once more to continue being good at making her repayments. She is very happy to work alongside the community bank members as they are all very united and responsible. 
She will use the $950 she is requesting to buy ingredients and supplies to continue her business and to prepare a greater variety of dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies to make a greater variety of dishes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 42 years old, married to Grace and they have four children. He has been in the charcoal sales business in Nakuru for the last three years. He was introduced to Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, by one of its existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more charcoal for sale and to sustain his business.

In the future, David hopes to invest more in his business, generate more income and venture into the property business mainly by building commercial buildings and residential houses.

loans.use: To increase his stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jawer José

texts.es:
El joven Jawer José es originario del municipio de El Sauce, tiene muchos años de dedicarse al comercio donde su negocio consiste en una pequeña pulpería bien surtida donde ofrece abarrotería en general, ropa y zapatos.

Gracias a esta actividad tiene un mejor nivel de vida junto a su esposa ya que trabajan en conjunto y son un matrimonio que lucha por salir adelante y tratar de cumplir siempre sus sueños.

Uno de sus grandes alcances ha sido construir e ir mejorando su vivienda con todas las condiciones adecuadas, cuentan con su propio vehículo, todo esto ha sido gracias a las utilidades que le genera su negocio.

Hoy en la actualidad este joven necesita el apoyo por primera vez de Ceprodel ya que su objetivo principal de solicitar este crédito es para invertirlo y surtir más su negocio por lo que quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, pollo y gaseosas.
Pone la esperanza en esta Institución para que le apoyen con su solicitud para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y confía en Dios salir adelante.
texts.en:
The young man Jawer José is originally from the town of El Sauce. He has worked in business for many years. His business consists of a little, well-stocked grocery store, where he offers groceries in general, clothing, and shoes.

Thanks to this business, he and his wife have a better standard of living, since they work together and are a couple that strives to advance and always tries to accomplish their dreams. 

One of his great achievements has been to construct and continue improving their house with all the appropriate conveniences. They have their own vehicle. All this has been thanks to the profits that his business generates.

Now this young man needs support from Ceprodel for the first time, since his main objective in applying for this loan is to invest it and stock his business more. To do this he wants to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, chicken, and soft drinks.

He puts his hope in this institution that they will help him with his request so that he can satisfy the demands of his customers, and he trusts in God that he will advance.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, chicken, and soft drinks

loans.name: Juvencio Misael

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Leónidas Proaño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive don Juvencio, tiene 49 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno es mayor de edad y el menor tiene 17 años el mismo que  estudian en universidad y es el que  aun vive con ellos. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Él para ganarse el sustento diario de su familia se dedica a conducir un  taxi de su propiedad, dia a dia sale a recorrer por toda la ciudad realizando los fletes que a la vez le dan para ganarse la vida, trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00,  solo trabaja hasta esa hora para evitar los robos y riesgos que tiene su profesión. Lleva más de 24 años en esta profesión gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido bien.

Solicita el crédito para comprar ciertas refacciones y repuestos para su taxi y así dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la forma como se trabaja en la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener otro taxi para así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Leónidas Proaño Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of the same name in the city of Manta, known for its pretty beaches that are visited frequently in every season of the year and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Juvencio lives here.  He is 49 years old and married, and from this relationship has two children.  One is independent and the younger one is 17 and studies in the university, and he is the one who still lives with them.  His wife is a housewife.

To support his family he works driving his own taxi.  Every day he goes out to drive around the entire city providing freight service that at the same time allows him to earn a living.  He works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  He works only until that time to avoid the robberies and risks of his profession.  He has worked in this profession for more than 24 years; he thanks God it always has gone well for him.

He is requesting the loan to buy certain spare parts for his taxi, and so give his customers better service.  This is his second cycle in the communal bank and he likes it because of how they work in the institution.

His dream is to have another taxi to have better income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
This is Amalia, 50, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a mother to three children and married to Paciano, also her business partner. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amalia operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this she sells dried fish for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.
